project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A decentralized P2P network to enable subsea inspection data to be shared securely and inexpensively without relying on intermediaries.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


.
Why do we need to enhance data sharing of subsea inspection images and videos?
Most of the companies and entrepreneurs working in the subsea Inspection, Maintenance and Repair (IMR) field have been struggling with proper access to subsea images and videos for years and years. Still today, there is no database compiling this data at a worldwide basis and a huge part of interesting subsea images and videos remains unused, stored in hard disks inside forgotten dusty warehouses, with no further use possible.
Based on recent industry trends of robotics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, autonomous vehicles, internet of things, etc., many companies, research centers, universities, and entrepreneurs have been developing innovative data-processing tools to enhance their product developments. These players have been looking forward to better understanding how to combine different technologies (i.e., computer vision, machine leaning, blockchain, etc.) with their underwater robots working in the Oil & Gas and Offshore Wind Energy markets, where the need to reduce operating expenditures continues to challenge owners and operators to improve efficiencies and enhance safety in maritime operations.
Many of the players mentioned above are currently developing their own AI-based image recognition tools to enable deeper insight on offshore assets integrity condition. For that purpose, they intend to use their Remote Operated Vehicles (ROVs) to effectively collect, process, and perform advanced data analytics, enabling data-driven decision-making tasks on site. For instance, the automatic detection of key features and/or anomalies could use Machine Learning / Deep Learning algorithms trained by relevant data in thousands of hours of survey videos, which unfortunately are not available yet at a global basis. Traditional offshore Oil & Gas assets' structures are somehow standardized (particularly in offshore wind farms where all turbines have the same structure), presenting enough regularity to allow patterns to be learned by the ML algorithms.
Fortune Business Insights has estimated that the subsea Inspection, Maintenance and Repair (IMR) market size was USD 7.19 billion in 2018 and is projected to reach USD 17.33 billion by 2026, with decommissioning, revitalization works, and increasing focus on unmanned vehicles being the major drives for market growth ( https://www.fortunebusinessinsights.com/industry-reports/offshore-inspection-repair-maintenance-market-100405 ). Based on the afore-mentioned gap identified in this subsea market, we are proposing herein a Blockchain distributed ledger which has the potential to become the new solution for a worldwide decentralized subsea data network of underwater inspection players mutually contributing to one another.
 
Why using blockchain?
Most of the classic authentication methods and centralized security mechanisms used in shared databases require a trusted third-party, whose systems sometimes lack security in design, are not able to defend against cyberattacks, face resource constraints, etc. Besides that, ensuring that data transmitted across networks are kept secure and private without high computational cost remains a challenge. The current settlement and reconciliation processes involved in these data transactions could be solved using Blockchain technology, which will impact the cost of verification of these transactions in the distributed ledger proposed herein.
Blockchain will facilitate decentralized storage for recording underwater inspection data and secure processing and sharing of this data among different entities. Blockchain technology is the ideal solution for this application which require decentralized access control, storage, and distributed trust. Blockchain will provide support in terms of data security and integrity. The secure routing of underwater inspection imaging data through the hierarchical topology of the Blockchain platform will ensure the legitimacy of all data sources to all platform participants, allowing them to use this data at their own interest and benefits, as previously explained.
 
SuBChain, a Distributed Subsea Data Ledger
SuBChain aims at becoming the standard Blockchain solution for a leveraged distributed, decentralized peer-to-peer network to enable subsea inspection data to be shared and stored securely and inexpensively without relying on any intermediary authorities, while still ensuring data privacy.
The participants of this Blockchain platform will be processing and validating underwater inspection data prior to confirming the inclusion of this data to the system via consensus mechanism, eliminating the need of intermediaries' involvement to process this data, preventing fraudulent activities, and ensuring data immutability, transparency, and operational resilience of the ledger by leveraging public key infrastructure to authenticate, authorize entities, and encrypt subsea data records.
Tokenization will help bootstrap the network by providing platform users with the incentives to contribute their resources to build and sustain it. The role of the Tokens will be played in incentivizing the growth, operations, and security of the platform, by helping it expand its user base and honestly reward underwater inspection professionals who contribute to the ledger with their digital assets.
Some activities that could be encouraged via Tokens are constructive feedback on the inspection videos (with some monitoring to avoid "robot" users generating automatic activities to get those rewards), referrals of the platform to other professionals, etc. For example, writing positive reviews about the platform and freely marketing it to others will help attract more users and boost the platform's relevance.
The Tokenization should adopt a smart user-rewarding strategy. For example, independent professionals and operators can upload their data to the platform and get token-rewarded based on the number of times their videos are used by other users. Tokens can be assigned to the users each time their video is used or downloaded and then they can later redeem their tokens for money, thereby building a reputation system within the platform.
 
-> A more detailed version of this proposal can be checked in the attachments.
 
Development Roadmap
Phase 1 - Proof of Concept (PoC) – Nov/2021

Applying for Fund6
Subcontracting external developers to help us build the PoC as a prototype with all user personas: Admin, Users, Employees, etc. This PoC will be a web page that will in the future be connected to Cardano. Estimated delivery: Apr/2022.

Phase 2 - Complete Solution Build – May/2022

Demo the PoC to internal parties, collect comments and build a first MVP. 
Start attaching the whole ecosystem onto Cardano.

Phase 2 will deliver a functional MVP that can then be used to demonstrate the PoV and attract investors and potential partners. Estimated delivery: Ago/2022.
Phase 3 – Final Setup – Sep/2022

Finish transferring the web page onto Cardano by Sep/2022
Make UX improvements and UI advanced design
Perform Quality Assurance (QA)

 
Milestones

6 months after Funded (from Nov/2021 to Apr/2022): After six months, the PoC is successfully validated and ready to start being integrated to the Cardano blockchain.
10 months after Funded (from May to Ago/2022): The first MVP will be launched by Jul/2022, allowing it to be stress-tested for real use.
12 months after Funded (from Sep to Oct/2022): The Distributed Subsea Data Ledger ("SuBChain") will start getting traction and growing adoption via a Beta version launched to a small set of users inside the Cardano community.

 
KPIs

Number of user subscribed to the wait list
Number of active users after the platform is launched
Number of transactions after the platform is launched
Revenue generated via transactions

 
The Team

Rodrigo Castro is an Electrical Engineer from the O&G and Energy industry with +15 years' experience in R&D, Disruptive Innovation, Business Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and Project & Operations Management. He has worked for leading players of the offshore engineering market, like TechnipFMC and SBM Offshore, and on subsea robotics companies like Cybernetix and Forssea Robotics. Rodrigo has a Master in Oil & Gas & Energy, an MBA in Business Analytics (having travelled the world as a Global Ambassador for HULT International Business School (Boston / Dubai / London), and extension courses at MIT Sloan School of Management (MIT Computer Science & Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL)) focused on AI and its implications for Business Strategy, Applied Business Analytics, Blockchain Technologies for Business Innovation and Application, and Implementation of Industry 4.0 for Leading Change in Manufacturing and Operation. His full work experience and educational background can be accessed here:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/rodrigo-castro/
Victor Corcino is a Chemical Engineer having worked in the O&G industry for the past 7+ years in companies like Braskem and TechnipFMC, with solid background in detailed engineering, R&D, Life of Field and conceptual design projects. He holds a Master in Chemical and Biochemical Processes Engineering, in which he has worked with Computational Simulation applied to O&G equipment. He is a member of the Flow Assurance Technical Committee at SPE Brazil Section, supporting the organization of events, knowledge sharing, national networking improvement and expertise exchange between Academy and Industry. Victor has also completed courses in Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Machine Learning, and he is currently taking a Doctor of Science degree in Computational Fluid Dynamics, Machine Learning and Uncertainty Quantification at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro. His full work experience and educational background can be accessed here:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/victorcorcino/

We are also in the process of reaching out to developers for them to take charge of some of the developments that needs to be done in order to deliver this proposal, especially Haskell developers.
 
Budget Breakdown

Project Design: $1800
DApp architecture: $585
UI/UX, Frontend and Backend Development: $12330
Infrastructure: $500
Blockchain Integration: $585
Project Management: $3240
Contingency: $952

-> A more detailed version of the budget can be checked in this proposal's attachments.
.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Credit unions and banks are regulated and insured by the NCUA and FDIC respectively and can issue certificates of deposit as on-chain coins.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


In the United States, a certificate of deposit (CD) is one of the most secure financial assets – insured by either the NCUA or the FDIC each up to 250,000 USD. A CD constitutes a document that signifies the right to withdraw funds that were deposited into an account after a specified period of time plus interest. In practical terms, when a person purchases a CD, for $10,000, the person provides $10,000 to the bank. The bank deposits that money into a special account that corresponds to that particular certificate of deposit. This account is located in and managed by the Bank of the Federal Reserve where it can be insured. The bank then issues a certificate that gives the customer the right to withdraw that deposit plus interest after a specified period of time at a specified interest rate. If the person would like to redeem his or her CD prior to the end of the specified term, there is also a specified fee that the person would have to pay to redeem his or her CD sooner than originally specified. While this instrument is excellent as a secure asset protected from inflation, it could also be a secure tool to convert USD into tokens redeemable for a dollar. It will be inexpensive for the Credit Union to pay the Fed to generate a daily statement of the amount of USD in each insured account (https://www.frbservices.org/financial-services/accounting/daily-statement.html). 
Credit Unions are non-profit organizations owned by their members whose mission is to support their communities. I am partnering with my local credit union to develop a tool to enable the purchase of CDs with the certificate itself as a set of tokens on the blockchain with a one-to-one correspondence between the number of tokens and the number of insured dollars in the account. These CDs will have no penalty for being redeemed at any time, and as a result, they will not pay interest. Rather, they will just be used to easily and inexpensively convert between stable tokens and USD in a safe and secure way.
Each CD token (CDT) will belong to an asset class with metadata that describes its date of issuance, the institution that issued it, and the account at which its funds can be found. At any time, any CDT will be able to be returned to its bank of issuance and redeemed for its face value from its associated account. When CDT is returned to its bank, it will be burned. Depending on the institution, it ought to be the case that the only fees will be the Cardano transaction fees as banks and credit unions will benefit by being able to offer a greater variety of securities and services to their customer base which will itself expand as the reach of the institution will expand to that of the entire Cardano network.
In the Metadata Challenge, I will submit a proposal to create a metadata server that will monitor the state of audited accounts against the state of their on-chain representations. This will allow consumers to freely transact in different issuances of stable tokens from different institutions and allow wallet applications to treat them as being interchangeable.
This will be good for my local community because I would like to be able to employ the homeless via smart contracts. I would also like to decrease the amount that local businesses have to pay in fees to the Visa-Mastercard network. These benefits extend to any community all over the world with a reliable stable token. So long as the Federal Reserve exists, so as long as the US Dollar exists, these tokens will be secure, stable and protected.
Success in 3 months will be that in which we have a proof-of-concept running on the test net such that it has been integrated with Campus USA Credit Union's accounting systems and automated via the banking portal. Success in 6 months will constitute having scaled to users in Gainesville and having offered education to local businesses on how to accept payments and account using CDT on Cardano. At 12 months, if IOHK has implemented Babel fees, we should see mass local adoption in partnership with the City of Gainesville.
I do not expect to benefit financially in the near term, so if I could have $50 for transportation costs for my trips between my domicile and the Credit Union, it would be awesome.
I expect to have a public launch on or by February 1st, 2022.
Attached, I have included a working draft of the proposal that I am providing to the banks. It is a rough draft, but please judge it harshly. I will update it as quickly as possible as I refine my approach and finish my implementation.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A DApp marketplace run by farmers cooperatives to sell farm products directly to local buyers with onchain NFT and transactions.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


⭐ Introduction
Climate change disaster, biodiversity collapse, degradation and artificialization of soils, depletion of energy and mineral resources, economic and political instabilities: the current crisis is alarming for agriculture. Agriculture accounts for 70% of water use and ⅓ of the food produced is either lost or wasted, the sector need profound change in the food production and consumption habits. More than 475 millions smallholders are the first impacted by climate change. They have less and less visibility on their production have to secure a growing demand for fresh and healthy products and responde to industial standards at the same time. To protect smallholders two distinct systems were developed: farmers cooperative and community shared agriculture (CSA).
Farmers cooperatives have emerged to give farmers social and economical benefits, enhance farmers' bargaining power, reduce trading cost, collecte funds and bring environmental incentive for consumers to trust farmers. Inside a cooperative a smallholder can brand his product in a larger market , and coordinate his production resulting in higher and better product quality. [1] Cooperatives have seen difficulties in working with big retailers' supply chains: unfair practices such higher prices on the wholesale market sale, monopoly on vegetable production and products rejections. It was challenging for retailers firm to integrate small scale farm due to complex transaction process and supply chain integration.
CSA is a local farm production-marketing and partnership between farmers and consumers that include (a) conservation of ecosystem (b) farm work support and payment in advance (c) suffisent income from the CSA which compensates for the cost of farm production [2] (d) sharing the risk. In practice, the community of shareholders funds the operation of a local farm at the beginning of the growing season in exchange for weekly deliveries of fresh produce and other food products (eggs, dairy, meats) over the course of the harvesting period. It's beneficial for farmers that are insured against risks of potential environmental factors leading to low crop yield, and consumers, who gain abilities to influence decisions such as crop production ratios to better suit the needs of the community. However CSA faces many challenges including natural disasters and scale expansion.
💸 Market perspectives
Farmers cooperatives market is a global market that generates economy and employment. In the United States around 3000 farmer cooperatives, including 1.9 Millions farmers generate 8 B USD every year [2] . In Europe, the total turnover of the 100 largest agricultural coops in 2019 was estimated at 237 billion euros. France only has more than 2,850 agricultural co-operatives with a collective turnover of 83.7 billion Euro. In China the development of farmers cooperatives is growing at a fast pace. By the end of October 2019, the number of registered farmer cooperatives is estimated at 2.2 millions. In South Africa, Farmers cooperatives play an important role for smallholders to access markets [3] .
Since 1970, CSA has developed from Japan [4] and Switzerland to the US and spread across Europe and China. With more than 300 projects in operation in China in 2019.[5] With 7398 farms in 2019 in the US CSA market was valued at 226 millions USD [6]. The 3 main reasons evoked by consumers to get involved to buy products in a CSA model are the sustainable production, the healthy and high quality food [7].
Blockchain food to table traceability solution help across various stages of the global supply chain and ensure safety efficiency and accountability for farmers. This market that will reach 886 million in 2025, is targeted by many startups (AgUnity, Agriledger, Farmer Connect, The New Fork) that work closely with farm cooperative. However these solutions are highly centralized,not open source and cannot be run by communities or cooperatives themself. Other blockchain application such productionownership, community cooperation, and locally self-sufficient economies are alos under exploited. This application can directly participate to CSA transactions between farmers and consumers and help governments and NGOs to help farmers cooperative.
🍅 Product
We introduce an open source marketplace run by cooperative or CSA community that protects smallholders and of direct transactions with buyers.
On one side the marketplace is permissioned by cooperatives to verify and integrate farmers to a local farm group (also called Drive) . The platform will provide a console for farmers to manage and distribute his products as NFT (cf. Fund6 | NFT Busines model | Digital Twin NFT for farm products).
On the other side, the marketplace is public and help customers to look for the closest Drive pick up point by searching around their location. The buyer journey will be the following: inspect and pick up several products, place an order, choose to have a free deliver at a pick-up place (Drive stand) or pay to get delivered at home by a courier. (1) Buyers make orders directly from several farmers and can only add product in the course of the week (farmers have limited time and production).
When the online order is complete, the marketplace will distribute all the paiement confirmation in real time to all the farmers, and farmer for them to prepare their products (2) Once a week, Farmers send their products to the drive. (3) buyers will either pick-up their food basket at the Drive or if available, to choose a courier to get delivered at home. The marketplace gives the opportunity for any buyer to invest in farmers' pre-seed production several months in advance then participating in a CSA project.
This marketplace can also include multiple application that help farmers local groups to sell products. An agricultural asset map can help a consumer to explore available products and connect farmers products with buyers. Farmers cooperative can also choose to give a fee to working groups that saves cooperative needs for marketing, selling, product management, insurance to only left food production quality and sustainable production (cf.Diagrams). Two cooperatives will also be able to do NFT swapping thus both of the cooperatives will have more offers and be capable of reaching new consumers directly even from more distant cities. Finally this marketplace can develop green delivery system (bike, electricity courrier) in order to be even more sustainable and autonomous.
🎯 Acquisition
Cooperatives and farmers acquisition
The marketplace need to prove to the cooperative its a easy and reliable way for farmers to operate transaction locally. NFT transition will bring more technical power to cooperative and allow them to be more autonomous and independent and at the same time more align with agro-food industrial standards.
We can also develop a dedicated staking pool dedicated for decentralized agriculture where farmers and ADA holders will jointly expand the cardano ecosystem and ADA adoption.
Buyers and consumers acquisition
The marketplace will give new incentives for consumers to protect and access healthy food from local production, ensure security and traceability, reduce packaging, food waste and delivery emission. On chain transaction from consumers to farmers with cryptocurrency will strengthen the local supply and demand.
🧐 Monopoly
The marketplace is open source, run by farmer group /community themself thus aim to be scalable. Incentives will help farmers to create NFT of their products and sell them into a cooperative local market then the marketplace will be auto-scalable.
This dApp is a way for consumers to get information synchronized directly with smallholders cooperatives capacity and pay for their products directly. This approach will leverage cooperative economic power and build a new model less vulnerable and more resilient founded on local small farmers capacity.
💰 Show us the money
Fund will be divided between a Cardano associate developer and a Agricultural science research to work on the following deliverables:


A marketplace prototype that integrate farmers and consumers functionalities and ADA transactions.


A research paper on the NFT and blockchain adoption for farmers cooperatives and introduce the marketplace development and principles.


As a written agreement, funds will be diretly distributed to the two positions mentioned. The autor will actively work on research effort and quest for funds.
🚗 Getting on the road [soon]
For the next 3 months work on farmer console management and NFT product display and on the first part of the research paper. For the next 6 months the research paper will be completed and submitted, the platform should be able to integrate multiple farmers in one location and handle buyer transaction.
For the next 12 months the platform will be fully operational, buyers should be able to make paiments to multiple farmers and farmers able to receive transaction.
Defining success
Our mission is to open NFT to farmers for them to become a maker with the same level of technical, legal and bargaining power as agro-food industrial and decentralized agriculture.
By creating an online platform for farmers to become NFT maker we hope it will protect their ownership, products and prices, improve the supply chain freshness and access credit from collateral. Production will become responsive to local needs and supply chains will be structured around value creation.
📃  References
1. Yu L, Nilsson J. Farmers' Assessments of Their Cooperatives in Economic, Social, and Environmental Terms: An Investigation in Fujian, China. Front Environ Sci Eng China. 2021;9: 151.
2. Paul M. Community-supported agriculture in the United States: Social, ecological, and economic benefits to farming. J Agrar Chang. 2019;19: 162–180.
3. Sikwela MM, Fuyane N, Mushunje A. The role of cooperatives in empowering smallholder farmers to access markets: A case study of Eastern Cape and KwaZulu Natal cooperatives in South Africa. Journal of Development and Sustainability. 5: 536–552.
4. Henderson E, Van En R. Sharing the Harvest: A Citizen's Guide to Community Supported Agriculture, 2nd Edition. Chelsea Green Publishing; 2007.
5. Tang H, Liu Y, Huang G. Current Status and Development Strategy for Community-Supported Agriculture (CSA) in China. Sustain Sci Pract Policy. 2019;11: 3008.
6. Plakias ZT, Demko I, Katchova AL. Direct marketing channel choices among US farmers: evidence from the Local Food Marketing Practices Survey. Renew Agric Food Syst. 2020;35: 475–489.
7. Saltmarsh N, Meldrum J, Longhurst N. The impact of community supported agriculture. Bristol Soil Association. 2011 [cited 29 Aug 2021]. Available: https://ueaeprints.uea.ac.uk/id/eprint/47181/

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A trustless source of truth with a distributed front-end, so everyone can see the same ideas and evidence, and have the same conversation.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


In the existing information / media ecosystem, the truth of an idea is not the most important determiner of whether or not it is believed. Shared Reality is intended to change that. Part of that is an immutable source of truth, where all controversial documents can be warehoused and available in their original forms, without requiring the public to trust any person or institution. We also need this information to be presented by a distributed front-end which would ensure that the strongest rebuttals and counter-rebuttals are presented where they belong - right next to the assertions that form people's perceptions of reality.
 
The existing information ecosystem allows disinformation to thrive and prevents the public from having effective defenses against disinformation, propaganda, or active measures techniques.
 
For example:
 

It doesn't matter how many people are upset about a prevailing narrative. (For example, whether vaccines do or do not cause autism.) It doesn't matter how upset they are. And, it doesn't matter how much time goes by. They can never take meaningful steps to resolve their discomfort. Their mental health and relationships can suffer.

 

Any entity with enough resources can create paralysis on any issue by injecting disinformation into the public mind whenever they see public consensus building against them. Controversies and problems are never resolved. New controversies, also never resolved, are introduced regularly.

 

When people want to know about climate change, they hear from pundits, magazines, and media conglomerates instead of hearing directly from actual climate scientists. Before the Internet, this made sense. Now, however, it's an outdated, inefficient, costly, and dangerous way to manage an information ecosystem.

 
We are currently living through an information war. Our trust has been very skillfully manipulated over decades in a divide and conquer process called Active Measures (or Ideological Subversion). Either the 2020 US presidential election was stolen or it wasn't. The existing media will not be resolving this controversy. If they were, they would have done it a long time ago. We need new tools to address and resolve this situation, or we can likely expect the worst.
 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reality-based_community
"The aide said that guys like me were 'in what we call the reality-based community,' which he defined as people who 'believe that solutions emerge from your judicious study of discernible reality.' [...] 'That's not the way the world really works anymore,' he continued. 'We're an empire now, and when we act, we create our own reality. And while you're studying that reality—judiciously, as you will—we'll act again, creating other new realities, which you can study too, and that's how things will sort out. We're history's actors...and you, all of you, will be left to just study what we do'."
- From a George W Bush senior White House aide, in 2004.
 
That does appear to be how it's sorting out. I hope we are all on the same page about that. Competing realities are being manufactured and people are living their lives inside these Big Lies. We need better weapons in the war against disinformation.
 
Shared Reality will provide the tools the public needs in order to protect itself from the Big Lie and other tactics which are now being used to destabilize Western-style democracies. 
 
The key to shifting this paradigm is frictionless, two-way communication between the people who know things and the people who want to know those things - especially across social boundaries (like political party affiliation).
 
A centralized version of such a platform can be found in a closed beta state at https://sharedreality.solutions . The missing next features are a blockchain-based data store and distributed front-end. This proposal includes the creation of a read-only front-end for non-authenticated public users. Other features (for adding and organizing information, etc) will be made distributed in the future.
 
I'm looking for developers and others to help make this a reality. Please reach out with feedback, etc. Thank you

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A mechanism to take funds directly from paychecks or to have Bank funds or Cardano collateral verified.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


https://www.etags.com/blog/what-is-a-car-repossession-and-how-does-it-hurt-your-credit-score/
For every 2.4 cars sold 1 will be reposessed.  A repossession can negatively affect a borrower for 7 years.  The goal of the DAAP would be to put electric vehicles in the hands of those who want/need them and to allow investors to be part of something they believe in.  Accessible financing for clean transportation.  If we can provide users with a less risky, lower priced loan while being backed by a better asset, the electric car, we can keep monthly payments low enough to be competitive with traditional internal combustion vehicles with high predatory rates.  20% predatory loan practices are common for the used auto sales.
Car ownership is near a must in some places in the US.  Commuting 2 hours by bus each way is not feasible for most if a car gets repo'd. Not having a car might limit your Once a credit score becomes ruined by a repo it becomes more difficult to get an apartment to rent. This can spiral and add stress to people already under financial pressure.  Electric cars are usually more expensive than internal combustion cars (ICE's) so they are out of reach of many low income car buyers.  The caveat is that electric cars will likely last 300-500K miles without much repair.  A great example would be a 2013 Chevy volt that would cost around $9,000.  These vehicles will also save their owners around $1000-2500 per year in gas and maintenance.  This should free up capital for the owner to repay the loan.  The one issue might be charging but some counties are now requiring charging stations at apartments.    The DAPPS goal is to make electric vehicles accessible and to set low income folks up for financial success.   The more successful people in the world the safer and more well off all of us are.  The DAPP would allow allow Cardano members to participate in funding rounds.  The funding rounds would set aside cash for the length of the loan, likely 5 years.  These funding rounds would take the form of tokens which would have a fluctuating value based on demand.  As funds are paid back by users the DAPP would purchase the tokens back from Token owners at a set interest rate.  The benefit of doing a token is it allows investors to back out of the investment if they need their funds for something else. Interest purchases of the tokens could happen as often as weekly or could follow Cardano's staking timeline.  If for some reason alot of users pulled out of their investments the price of the token would drop and thereby be a better return for new investors.  The token would have an end value of $100 at the end of 5.5 years.  The initial value of the token would be around $71 and continue to increase given the repayment of loans.  The funding rounds would occur every quarter or so. If funds are unused after 3 months the funds would roll into new tokens of the same value in the next funding round.  This allows the Daap to fluctuate funding for loans based on demand.  Funds would be held in cash.  Say the token repurchase happened every epoch this would keep the price of the token consistent.  We would divide the token up by the epoch with interest included so that every 3 days a repurchase of a percentage of your token would occur.  By having regular repurchases the price of the token should remain relatively stable and liquid although people pulling out of their investment would likely do so at a small loss.  We might want to provide a mechanism for people to exit their position during new funding rounds so that new investors can take their place.
 
The tenants of the DAPP would be as follows. 


qualified plug in electrics or hybrids are applicable for the loan.  We would review the borrower's income, cash they have available commuting requirements and make car make and model recommendations.  Borrowers who are attempting to purchase too much car for their income will be rejected.  We want to encourage responsible borrowing.  Electric vehicles hold their value much better the ICE's so there is less risk to the DAAP


The company would be the holder of the assets until loan paid off as collateral 


Loans could be delayed for up to 1 year without interest payments  or more given they pay interest payments and keep in contact with the company.  The user would not have to give a reason for being unable to pay.  This allows for life to happen, medical bills, being laid off, natural disasters, unexpected costs of moving, debt repayment to happen.  As long as the user stays in contact with the company, pays off interest if required and sends time stamped photos of the assets no actions will be taken. 


4)  Part of the organizations mission is financial education, this could include videos recommendations to borrowers regarding credit card debt, managing budgets, shopping for health, car, home insurance, improving credit scores.  Another aspect would be a secure messaging system for which borrowers could send video messages to the DAPP employees letting them know how they are doing financially and how the program has helped them.  It might be a mandatory condition of getting a loan so that the DAPP developers can better cater to borrowers and put a human face to their work.  The videos would not be shared without consent.  These videos could be great marketing material for future funding rounds.


Interest rates would be reasonable. Lets say no more than 4% over inflation.  In today's environment I would hope for rates no higher than 6-8%.  


Standard repossession practices would be in place if contract is broken 


A friend must vouch for you and provide a real name and address.  We will send this person a packet describing our company and try to encourage them to get an EV.  This is not a co-signer, just a real person so that the system isn't taken advantage of and that there is some assurance the person is of good nature.


The organization would be positive for borrowers credit score 


the DAPP (individuals backing loans and the borrowers) would agree to donate 1% total to a fund that would provide charging stations where needed in the US or abroad. A percentage would go back into the DAAP's fund to ensure its financial future.


The application will be automated and online.  Automatic payments would be encouraged


The loans would be paid directly via wire transfer to car dealerships or approved car buying websites.  This ensures that there is a transaction occurring, all appropriate taxes are being paid and titles can be mailed back to us.  


Borrowers would have to provide proof of employment


 

There is no income threshold and the lower the risk of the applicant the lower the interest amount.  An ideal applicant might be someone who can realistically only afford a $5000 vehicle and can't put any money down or it might be someone who wants a used model 3 for $25K and is putting down $10K

 
 
 
Funds will go towards setting up banking requirements, paying for developers to develop website and phone apps for android and apple, marketing.  Our primary marketing would be web based, maybe on youtube or google.  Anyone looking for used cars would be our target audience.  We would also need staff to help educate borrowers, execute title transfers and handle delinquent borrowers.
 
I have no specific skills as far as programming but have the drive to see something like this to completion and the willingness to put together a great team around me to make electric cars accessible to the masses.
Definition of success:
Success after 3 months:  1) hire technology team to help with web development 2) put together a youtube video to describe our progress.  3) hire business development employee 5) hire accountant
 
Success after 6 months: 1) assess the scale of the opportunity/addressable market. Use this data to set initial funding goals and token issuance. 2)  layout timeline for testing DAAP
 
Success after 12 months: 1) successfully test DAAP via blockchain 2) successfully transact a pilot project loan with multiple dealers
Success after 18 months: 1)Successfully transact a pilot loan in multiple states, assess need abroad and transact in another country
 
Success after 24 months: Roll out first round of tokens for funding round.
 
Our proposal impacts the challenge of a glut in car repossessions by providing reasonable rates to people who otherwise have terrible credit and no means to get a reasonable rate.  We provide a means for borrowers to repay these loans by getting them into electric vehicles which have lower operating costs.  We provide flexibility. Life happens, people lose jobs, their financial situations change. Too often people purchase too much vehicle and we will do our best to prevent this.  We might have options for a person to downgrade their vehicle to meet their current budget.
 
Budget requirements are as follows compensation includes employee benefits


Business Development employee-$100-150K annually


Accountant $100-150K annually


Marketing-$300k annually


4)  3 technology developers-  $600k annually
5)  Other overhead $500K
 
This should give us runway for at least 2-3 years before we can start self funding from the loan business

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Our website https://adafolio.com provides a platform for community members to create and share portfolios of multiple stake pools.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


The website https://adafolio.com currently hosts over 100 diverse portfolios of stake pools and allows community members to create, update, and share these portfolios manually. Our goal is to improve the usability of this community-focused tool by adding an Application Programming Interface (API) to allow third-party organizations and services to curate and consume the portfolios. By providing this service, we will effectively connect delegators to the pools that support the causes and projects that are important to them, thereby strengthening both the network and the community.
The upgrade will consist of two thrusts:
1. Develop an easy-to-use API for projects and organizations to automate the process of curating custom portfolios hosted by adafolio. The estimated time and cost for this is three months and $5000.
It is our goal to make the process of creating and updating portfolios easier for groups and organizations by providing an API for them to automate the curation of their portfolios. For example, consider a self-organized group that vets stake pools making donations to charity. The API will allow them to update a potentially large portfolio of stake pools much faster and with fewer errors.
2. Develop the API for interfacing the curated portfolios with wallets and other services. Refer to CIP-0017 for details on the proposed integration. An API is essential for projects and wallets to consume the community-generated portfolios. A rudimentary API currently exists for our integration with https://pooltool.io. The estimated time and cost for this upgrade is three months and $5000.
https://github.com/cardano-foundation/CIPs/blob/master/CIP-0017/CIP-0017.md

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A patient-centric blockchain-based data marketplace system. This system addresses data transactions, exchanges, and privacy specifications.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


A patient-centric blockchain-based data marketplace system. This system addresses data transactions, exchanges, and control/privacy specifications using Cardano blockchain technology to encrypt patients data as decentralized
storage.
GELMA wants to allow patients to have full control over their medical data to provide pseudonymity and anonymity financial identity and reward mechanisms. Data is stored on the Cardano blockchain to achieve security, integrity, and accountability. Cryptographic functions are employed to provide immutability and eliminate data protection vulnerabilities. 
The proposed system is divided into two levels: the first level contains a Registration Unit where the authentication is done, a Private Accessible Unit (PAU) that acts as an intermediary between patient users, data buyers, and blockchain, and a decentralized app (DApp) for the patient to interact with the system. The second level represents the system backend (the permissioned blockchain) which contains the security-level elements of the proposed system.
Why GELMA and why now?
• Patient Data Personalisation – The prospect of more individualized 'n=1' healthcare data is accelerating.
• Remote access, localized support, and decision making are all central to creating more personalized information which in turn will drive better healthcare, precision medicine, and personalized treatment (e.g. gene therapy, genomics)
• Predictive analytics and genetic profiling will further transform treatments and the way pharmaceutical and biotech companies process patient data: mRNA, DNA, Genome Sequencing, etc.
Overview
• DApp for patient's data exchange to enable patient financial identity and allow patient data control to the corresponding owners.
• What is driving this business plan? Patients from all kinds of therapeutical areas and diseases should be able to control and benefit from their own data.
We want as well to promote data privacy, build trust and transparency from patient data exchanges with healthcare institutions, biopharmaceutical manufacturers, and supply chain players.
• Our vision: We want a world where trust, transparency, and authenticity are core values in the post-digital and post-COVID19 version of commerce between patients and institutions. We are on a mission to use Cardano's and leading healthcare and pharmaceutical partners to bring this vision to life.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Introduce Blockchain in the underrepresented
Bring traffic to partners
Universally revolutionize rewards program 
Users own their data
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


CLANITY CONNECTS BUSINESSES AND CUSTOMERS THROUGH OUR BLOCKCHAIN REWARDS AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM 
 
Clanity is the first blockchain technology that attempts to simplify and efficiently reward a large number of individuals who make subjective contributions to local businesses all around the world with a universal utility token.
 
Clanity as a solution
PROBLEM
Underutilized blockchain-based value additions
Blockchain is the most disruptive technology of the century but its adoption has not been warmly welcomed by the masses due to its technicality and lack of real world use case.
SOLUTION
Introduce Blockchain in the underrepresented rewards functions
We will provide a platform that is easy to use and of value so our community will have sustainable massive gains from joining Clanity which will be the catalyst for adoption.
PROBLEM
Online competitors challenging local physical retailers
With e-commerce and online retailers building market share over the past decade, brick-and-mortar companies are in trouble trying to keep up. This trend is causing less foot traffic to traditional business.
SOLUTION
Bring foot traffic to business partners
We will be reinventing the process of how businesses acquire new loyal customers. Clanity will offer efficient ways of targeting customers and effectively convert them into purchasing customers.
PROBLEM
Inefficient rewards programs
About 50% of loyalty program members are inactive. Many never engage or they opt out after a month. It lacks differentiation, fails to gain attention or attract new members and retain existing members.
SOLUTION
Universally revolutionize the rewards program
Clanity puts the customer at the center of our rewards program to drive results by enabling technologies that enhance the customer experience, and offer value propositions that are financially incremental.
PROBLEM
Decreased funding in local public schools
Countries are already cutting their education budgets to make space for the required spending on health and social protection. The hugely affected students mostly fall disproportionately on the poorest and most vulnerable.
SOLUTION
Supports low funded schools or high impact nonprofit organizations
Part of Clanity's goal is to support low funded schools and high impact nonprofits to ensure that the younger generation is well equipped to take over the responsibilities of world innovation.
PROBLEM
Data exploit by corporate giants
Once you sign the terms of service online to use a software, the organization gains control over your data. It might be surprising to know that not all major companies sell data because it is valuable. Companies that do sell data, get the money and the users get nothing.
SOLUTION
Users control and own their data
We respect our users' privacy. We want our users to have control and own their data. Allowing users to sell their own data for self-monetization to business partners.
 
Platform
Clanity plans to create platforms that are beautifully designed, simple and easy to use yet very well architectured and robust for both tech savvy and non-technical users.
User Friendly Design
Scalability & Quick Transaction Time
Minimal Transaction Fees
Trust & Transparency
Security
 
Clanity offers several uses that go beyond the normal peer to peer trading of cryptocurrency. We plan to go mainstream and ensure mass adoption.
 
Clanity's Planned Ecosystem and Funding Breakdown
CLANwallet $50,000
Integrates, processes and holds rewards, and also serves as a wallet for users.
CLANswap $50,000
Easily trade Cardano, Cardano native tokens and possibly other cross-chain cryptocurrencies with your Clanity tokens.
CLANbuzz $50,000
Materialize the community engagement and reward efforts for business partners and community members.
PayCLAN $50,000
Payment gateway for users to purchase products from business partners using their Clanity tokens.
DataCLAN $50,000
Allows the buying and selling of data between business partners and users.
 
Roadmap
Phase 1 -done
Website, Team, White Paper, Tokenomics
Phase 2 -in process
Business Formation & Compliance
Phase 3 
Marketing, Token Sale
Phase 4
CLANwallet Creation
Phase 5
Listing or Clanswap
Phase 6
CLANbuzz Creation
Phase 7
User Growth / Partnerships
Phase 8
PayClan Creation
Phase 9
DataClan Creation
Phase 10
Clanity World Summit
Expected launch date is 4th quarter of 2021.
Partners
MLabs is a Haskell, Rust, Blockchain and AI consultancy firm mainly focused in the fintech, payments and blockchain space. Their notable clients include Cardano, Juspay, Liqwid and SundaeSwap.
Gresham International are the market leaders in Cryptocurrency & Security Token Compliance and Legal Services. They have been nominated as COMPLIANCE FIRM OF THE YEAR 2018 IBLOCKCHAIN SUMMIT CHINA.
 
Network
Cardano is a blockchain platform for changemakers, innovators, and visionaries, with the tools and technologies required to create possibility for the many, as well as the few, and bring about positive global change.
Atala PRISM is a decentralized identity solution that enables people to own their personal data and interact with organizations seamlessly, privately, and securely.
 
Clanity plans to revolutionize the blockchain rewards program by creating a universal rewards token. We hope to return the power of finance back to the end users to promote financial inclusion. Once Clanity is fully and universally adopted, a cycle will then be established through the platform building self-sustaining communities, one town at a time, all over the world.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A privacy centric and secure digital identity solution which can be easily integrated for KYC in blockchain services such as DEX
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Many of the decentralised exchanges such as Binance are facing increasing regulatory pressure. In fact, Binance is slowly pivoting towards centralised practices such as users are required to undergo KYC in order to access the full suite of services. Currently, the KYC process requires users to submit a picture of their government IDs and the process could take up to 20 days. This is inefficient and will raise many privacy concerns. While the blockchain is pseudonymous in nature, regulatory for financial services might result in more blockchain services needing to comply to KYC rules in the near future. 
A digital identity solution that complies to the KYC rules will most probably have to be a unique ID system, meaning each person could only own one such ID. To achieve this, we need government to be the identity issuers. Each identity is stored in a digital wallet owned by the identity owner, while the identity claim is recorded in a smart contract on the Cardano blockchain. This timeline is in line with the Alonzo rollout plan. The concept is similar to self sovereign identity (SSI), however to ease integration into existing systems of decentralised exchanges, we plan to implement a set of APIs that could be called for identity verification and authentication. 
To provide a clearer picture of how it works, we will be building a platform portal, where identity issuers will issue identity credentials through this portal to identity owner's digital wallet. The portal will automatically record the identity claim in the smart contract. When the identity owner is required to perform KYC in decentralised exchanges, the identity owner will present the identity credentials to the verifier (the exchange). The verifier will then verify the authenticity of the credential through our portal, by calling the verification APIs, which essentially is a verification call to the smart contract, however abstracted away from the end users. 
Roadmap: First 4 months will be focusing on implementing the infrastructure, which includes identity issuance, storage and verification. We plan to leverage on existing open-source digital wallets for identity storage, and customise it to suit our needs. The subsequent 2 months will be focusing on community onboarding, which includes starting with onboarding a local / municipal government to be our pilot identity issuer, onboarding at least 100 users as our pilot identity owner, and onboarding 2 decentralised exchanges as our pilot identity verifiers for KYC purposes. 
Success metrics: 3 months - done with basic implementation of the digital identity infrastructure, starting on security auditing and QA testing. 6 months - Pilot identity issuers, identity owners and identity verifiers onboarded as users. Identify features for improvements. 12 months - Iteratively improve on features based on users feedback, manage to onboard a national government as an identity issuer, thereby increasing user base exponentially
Budget: 15000 USD for development cost in the first four months, which include hiring a full stack developer. 5000 USD for marketing cost, which includes online publicity, and cost for a part-time growth hacker. 
Expected public launch date: February 1st 2022.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Create a dapp marketplace for direct ticket sales, split payments, and automated reselling auctions enforced by smart contracts.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Desired Outcome
To provide a Cardano blockchain based ticket selling marketplace for live and virtual events powered by smart contracts
Blocking problem
Legacy ticket sellers are middlemen that place high fees on the actual good, with little prevention of scalping or fraud
Costs of the problem
Entertainment is one of the largest and fastest growing sectors in the world ($2.6 trillion by 2025). *1
Ticket scalpers market estimated to be $15.9B in 2020. *2 The largest ticket seller in the US made over 10B in revenue in 2019 *3.
Evidence
https://www.consumersinternational.org/news-resources/blog/posts/consumers-sold-out-the-trouble-with-ticket-resale/, https://www.choice.com.au/soldout, https://www.justice.gov/usao-edny/pr/ticketmaster-pays-10-million-criminal-fine-intrusions-competitor-s-computer-systems-0, https://www.accc.gov.au/consumers/online-shopping/drip-pricing, https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/22/arts/music/ticket-scalping-bots.html, https://www.ticketnews.com/2021/04/illegal-venue-rebates-new-york-ticketing-hearing/, *1 https://www.benzinga.com/news/21/07/21937648/global-entertainment-industry-to-generate-2-6-trillion-in-revenues-by-2025-report#:~:text=The%20global%20entertainment%20and%20media,as%20fueling%20this%20new%20vibranc *2 https://bigthink.com/politics-current-affairs/scalping, *3 https://www.statista.com/statistics/193700/revenue-of-live-nation-entertainment-since-2006/
Market: there is not yet a successfully implemented ticket sales platform on Cardano. Cardano is better suited than other blockchains to provide a backbone for a ticket service with the described functionality due to its speed, decentralization, security, scalability, and low cost of transactions. There is a huge market and opportunity for artists, venues and other entertainers to directly connect to fans with little to no middleman fees and markup, empowering more people to access their experiences, services and events. Our product will incorporate codified ethos to prevent common problems in the ticket and event services sector like scalping, misaligned reseller incentives, frontrunning, ticket transfer risk, proof of purchase, verifiable authenticity, and fair ticket payment plans.
Scalping: We will limit the number of orders that can be obtained within a certain time frame from any one purchasing address or account
Misaligned reseller incentives: We can provide an opt-in service to event organizers to algorithmically determine a fair price based on the proportion of tickets that are fully sold vs unsold, creating a fair value guarantee for ticket purchases.
Frontrunning: we will always be able to display the cost the reseller paid for the ticket to the buyer, reducing the chance for exorbitant markups. Accounts that are found to purchase tickets purely for the intent of reselling at a profit will have their purchasing ability limited even further than the default scalping logic would enforce.
Ticket transfer risk: We can provide secure 3rd party escrow, with proof of funds and proof of ticket ownership to ensure neither party is a bad actor with malicious intent, while still transferring tickets quickly and cheaply.
Proof of purchase: A digital NFT can be generated with each ticket sale, so that even after the ticket is used and the event is past, the attendee can have a free memorabilia and badge to proudly collect and display.
Verifiable authenticity: We can leverage the blockchain to ensure no duplicate tickets are sold and that the tickets are indeed created by the provider of the event or an affiliate. If the provider elects to have an affiliate sales reward program, this will easily be trackable with payments disbursed in near real-time as well.
Fair ticket payment plans: A buyer of a ticket can enter into a contractual agreement to purchase a ticket in installments. Any buyer who fails to provide the funds in full by a predetermined date will automatically forfeit the ticket to auction, where it can be purchased for the difference between what has been paid and the remaining balance for non-sold out events, or auctioned to the highest bidder in the case the event is sold out. Any funds above the fair market price will be used to reimburse the original purchaser a portion or all of their funds.
Budget: The primary use of the budget will be to fund dedicated remote developers to create the required smart contracts, plus a simple web client to facilitate more rapid iteration and testing. Additional funds may be sought in a later round of fundraising to establish partnerships with venues and entertainment companies, as well as for marketing initiatives. There is a separate proposal to fund mobile developers to develop a client app, empowering those around the world access on mobile devices, which is the dominant way citizens of the globe access the web. We would like to devote full time developers to this project, and estimate 1 full stack web developer, and 2 smart contract developers, plus a project manager will be sufficient at this stage for phase one. We are seeking $62,000 to hire and fund these roles for a 3-6 month time period (length depending on full or part time).
Roadmap: in the first month, we will finalize our agreements with the talent required to develop the smart contracts, create a more granular map of the work to be done and begin to code. Our initial focus will be on creating the underlying smart contracts and a simple web client, while the mobile team that has submitted their own proposal works on building out a full-fledged enterprise grade iOS and android app. This will allow us to reach the majority of the world's population despite many citizens having a mobile device with internet access, yet no computer, while also supporting access from a wide variety of end clients, regardless of browser or operating system. We will leverage an open source cross-platform mobile development platform for this task (React & React Native). The founding team has extensive experience using open source technologies to develop, launch and maintain enterprise grade web and mobile applications used by hundreds of thousands of users monthly.
By month three we aim to have begun testing and vetting the foundational smart contracts to enable interacting with the ticket platform. This includes listing, purchasing, and transferring ownership of the tickets. We will then turn our attention to the more sophisticated smart contracts that will differentiate our platform from legacy providers, enabled by the Cardano blockchain.
By month six we will provide additional functionality empowered by smart contracts as outlined above, like built-in scalper/bot detection and rejection, split payment contracts, and a reseller system.
Our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the first 6 months of the project will include shipping an initial version of the web client, deploying multiple iterations of the smart contracts on the Cardano Testnet, and beginning to integrate with the mobile client frontend for android and iOS.
Our year 1 KPIs will be to successfully deploy our vetted contracts to the Cardano mainnet, acquire at least 1 partnership with a venue or event organizer, and list tickets for sale to at least 1 pilot event. Our anticipated launch date would be August 2022.
IP: Our IP policy is to provide open source contracts for the vast majority of our logic, with only sensitive details of personal information or logic that may hinder our ability to fairly serve each user obfuscated from public view. We intend to provide our services for an industry leading "middle-man fee", and provide access to an API connected to our platform within a reasonable usage limit for free to spur additional development and accessibility options to the end user.
This project will be deemed successful if we bring to market a low-cost, frictionless experience to the end user to allow more people to enrich their lives with virtual and in person experiences from performing arts to business conventions, while empowering a more direct sales approach from artists and venues to attendees.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Creating a gamified curriculum that engages children and allows them to learn at their own pace. Offering a holistic practical education.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


This could be a great addition to Cardano's work in Africa as a great place to build out new curriculum and way of learning based on the same principles as Elon Musk's Ad Astra School. The Idea is to have it available on the blockchain so parents anywhere in the world home school there children with ease due to the bulk of the educational content being specially developed games with learning verification monitored by AI. Along with real world challenges that can be verified back to the blockchain via evidence of completion. The hope would be to communicate with governments of lesser developed countries and work with them to provide high quality educational resources to struggling communities and home-schoolers all around the world. As the system gets verified it could start to integrate into more 1st world countries. Ideally creating a more unified approach to education globally.  This is an educational system that will not leave kids behind disinterested and feeling stupid and not good enough.  This system engages children and works with them at their level what ever that level may be. If a child is a scholar in maths but not very good with language he/she could be doing year 12 maths and year 7 English etc. But the biggest advantage is the teachers can then focus on the social, emotional and philosophical aspects of education. Student can interact and work in teams with other children of varying ages. Teaching teamwork and co-operation to solve real world problems is something missing in todays schools and will help children intergrate smoothly into well functioning teams as they begin work.
 
Please check out my initial whitepaper that has been attached v0.2
 
This is a huge idea far outside my capabilities. I believe it is a very worthy idea and much like the adoption of blockchain itself the transformation of our education systems is inevitable. I feel like this is a project that needs to be done right which is why I think it is a great fit for the Cardano ecosystem. I think it would require heavy use of AI integrations which would also be a great project for Sing.Net and Cardaon to work together and show the world what they are capable of. I have yet to approach the sing.net team to see what is involved in creating an AI to manage the system and weather it is possible to integrate them into the games themselves to create constant variation at a suitable difficulty level.
I am going to refocus this funding proposal to give me the green light to build a project roadmap with detailed pricing and to confirmed team members and partnerships. 
Basically I am reducing the amount of funding necessary to get the project to the point where it can start seeking funding outside of project catalyst.
This would involve working together with sing.net and developing a proof of concept game and management system so trials can be done to showcase the effectiveness of the online based system. 
It would also involve creating a detailed segment of the curriculum to show that it will promote well rounded, outgoing socially engaged children with plenty of activities to do and not just a race of hunch backed computer freaks which could potentially be the criticism.
I am estimating $7,500  
I may need a we bit of price appreciation along the way but I feel this works well within the guidelines of what project catalyst is trying to achieve. It leaves plenty of funding for other projects and devs that can get to work right away on projects that may not take long to build. 
For those that have read this far I thank you for your time and please leave some feedback for me down below.
 
Finalizing My Proposal.
I do receive emails from Project Catalyst.
Will upload ID- Check attachments
How my proposal impacts the challenge. Building dapps and integrations on Cardano Blockchain to attract more users. 
My proposal would create an entire ecosystem of life long users for the Cardano Blockchain. If it is successful enough to get significant amount of adoption which is the goal it will bring millions maybe 100s of millions of users who will spend many years interacting with the Cardano Blockchain and also ideally Singularity net will be providing many AI calls to School of Life as well. Upon re read of the challenge brief I see the goal is for 2021. This project will not be ready for 2021.
Definition of Success after 3months- Funding received and initial trial curriculum material established. Working gamifing the lessons and AI integration.
6months- Trial curriculum completed with AI monitored learning games that can adjust level to suit performance of the student. Activity lessons planed out with feedback portal to the School of Life as proof of real world activities being carried out tested and completed. Within funding limits or more funding achieved to maintain progress.
12months- Trial work has been carried out on real school children with ongoing updates and improvements being implemented. More funding for a more complete product in the works or achieved and growing the team and support for the project.
Expected public launch date. This will depend entirely on funding and teambuilding to achieve the goals. I would expect 1 year after the trial to build an age 7 to 11 complete primary school package ready for launch. With the work continuing for many years and indefinitely building out a full scale education system spanning all ages, languages and subjects. 
My expected launch date would be at earliest Q4 2022 unless there is significant interest and assistance given to the project.
How do I address the challenge question? I struggle to differentiate this from the above "How dose my proposal impact the challenge. However on the question of how to bring more users to the cardano ecosystem via dapps and integrations I think I have put forward a very good proposal. If Cardano can become known as the blockchain of education it will have a never ending supply of millions of users who will be using the blockchain all of there lives. Obviously this will also help the success of other dapps on the chain because they will have a large pool of users already on the chain to draw from. I am very open about the fact that building this out properly sits well outside my current capabilities. I need many more resources than I currently have available. I would hope developers would see and like the idea and choose to be part of the project and the project will be able to reward them appropriately. I think this is a project that would span the entire career  for many developers. 
Budget breakdown- The budget is only a small portion of what is needed but $2000 would go towards researching and building the learning material over the first 3 months. The remaining $5500 will be put towards building out a trial game with AI monitoring. Giving us a proof of concept . I am hoping to entice extra value for the money spent by offering devs a stake in the project.
