project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Develop a platform where proposers can find skilled mentors from the Cardano's community that help to deliver solid proposals.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


The current Cardano's proposals funding process is attracting more and more proposers each fund, with an aim to reach more and more outside proposers out of brilliant entrepreneurs and purpose driven enthusiast to reach our goal to impact 1 Billion people.
During Fund5 there were around 316 proposals received, with 112 (35%) securing funds. 143 (45%) of those proposals were not approved by voters (negative votes vs positive votes spread) and 214 (67%) got less than a 4 score assessment by CAs.
This situation creates an increasing frustration among proposers, and this has the potential to worsen as more proposals are submitted and Cardano's growth accelerates. Increasing complexity of the space means that it is vital to keep proposals quality high by increased understanding of challenges and proposal's feasibility criteria and other key factors of the proposal process.
This situation is significantly harder for new proposers and outsiders. How can we make a difficult space easier. How can we help onboard the proposers that have been encouraged to join the space?
The Solution
We propose to facilitate proposal creation, promotion and execution, by enabling proposers to find help among skilled members of the Cardano's community that are willing to mentor projects and proposers. Working towards the achievement of outstanding results, value and increase the chances of being funded.
A dual sided market platform will be created to generate a Mentor Marketplace, where proposers can find, engage with or get matched to mentors.
This platform will serve as a unique directory of ranked mentors, that offer their help to proposal building, promotion and even execution (after funding). Mentors profile and success metrics will be visible at the platform, with certain key attributes that help the proposer to select/be matched to the relevant mentors who can help bring their ideas to become reality.
Mentor's will be able to monetize their advice, agreeing with the proposers during the process - a coming together to an agreement. We see that this might be in the form of pre-funding payment, post funding payment, equity interest or some mix or other in kind payment. The platform will help facilitate the agreement process.
In this initial stage we will experiment with this open option to learn what are the different monetization needs from the community. Later the platform could leverage smart contracts to help with the monetization of the efforts and the marketplace itself, and maybe helping also Cardano's to send and track funding for proposals.
We plan to leverage other projects that can help to increase our delivery speed, as well as to standardize the platform so many new functionalities can be built upon this marketplace, such as a possible partnership with the Community Members profile site (https://projectcatalyst.org/api/graphql).
The Team
The proposers have extensive experience in creating value added projects, and are committed to the Cardano's community as Community Advisors. Phil has a business and design background and has already successfully funded proposals in funds 4 and 5 funded which are: Community tools (https://cardanocataly.st/en/tools)and Community Landing Page (https://cardanocataly.st/).
Skilled developers and UX/UI designers will be hired to execute the technical aspects of the project. We have a understanding that Blace.io (a Catalyst spawned marketplace base layer https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Blace-io-Marketplace-Creator/368797-48088)) is under pre-funding development. We are in discussion with the team responsible for the project as a possible base layer for out market place.
This project also has the support of the Cardano AIM team.
Estimated Timeline
We aim to reach a first MVP within first two months, giving us time to get the team together and for blace.io releases their first versions for testing. We then plan to work towards a new release each month (each 2 Sprints).
This first phase of the project will last around 4 months, to deliver a first version of the platform, with core functionality such as having mentor's profiles searchable, with filter criteria functionality, and a way to produce the match/communication between parties.
After the first 4 months, we will aim to produce new evolution based on the insights obtained during the first phase, the type of business model that end up being selected and the willingness/approval/adoption by the community.
Sustainability (Business Model) and Challenge fit
In this phase we want to provide a free version of the platform to help build up momentum and give back to the community the funds obtained to jump starting the platform.
If the experiment is successful we can either continue to provide a free version (funded by the community) or produce a fee based model - we are considering perhaps a small percentage of funded proposals. So in both models the Cardano's ecosystem will benefit from more and higher quality proposals and more proposers (specially from outside the ecosystem), thus aligning with this challenge goal. By facilitating better ways to be involved with developing value on top of Cardano. Also by generating a source of income for Mentor's we will incentivize that mentor's participation and in the future work towards bring more projects to Cardano through referrals.
Key Metrics
These can be measured by engagement fund to fund:
Number of mentors actively on the platform
Number of proposals onboarded through the platform
Number of successful proposals mentored through the platform
Costs structure
3 Developers/UX - USD 3000 per month each - USD 36.000
2 Founders/Project Leader fees, USD 2.000 each.
Infrastructure and other platforms costs, USD 1000.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Proposal owners, their entertainment industry contacts and the Cardano community will change that with a feature film & global distribution.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


We need to think bigger, beyond our small but growing ecosystem, in relation to the majority of people in the world who are currently unaware of Cardano and Project Catalyst. Myself, my co-proposer and our entertainment industry partners have been working behind the scenes to structure a viable plan with the end goal of creating a large scale film project.
Our goal is to reach a global audience by tapping into pop culture's action/adventure film entertainment market. Action/adventure films are one of the leading genre films and bodes well as the backdrop for our hero product of CARDANO.
HOW WE WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS
We will tap into the several relationships we have built in the filmmaking industry ranging from studio relationships, global distribution channels, top tier talent including writers, actors and directors to put together a feasible total film package. Some of studio connections include but not limited to Tyler Perry Studios (Atlanta GA), Nu Boyana Studios (Sofia, Bulgaria). Distributors such as Lionsgate's Grindstone Entertainment Group. And Production companies that specialize in foreign sales such as Crystal Sky Pictures, AAA Entertainment (Johannesburg, South Africa).
GOALS: Short/Mid Term
Attracting Proposers - While this proposal falls within the realm of entertainment/filmmaking which carries a longer than average time horizon, the short/mid term goal will be to facilitate maximum community involvement within the Cardano community. This includes yet-to-be proposers who may have not yet submitted a proposal who wish to have product placement. The goal is to expose the creative spirit that this community possesses in addition to telling an interesting and compelling story.
With that, looking forward to Fund7 and beyond, we would collaborate on specifics and initiate separate "sub-proposals" for those interested parties looking for product placement and allow the Cardano community vote on the ones they would like to include in the film. This direct interaction would give anyone looking to gain exposure the opportunity to do so, with the community voting as they do currently on standard proposals.
*Interest and engagement within these film-specific "sub-proposals" would be one easily measurable KPI
Long Term
While a project of this scope has never been done before, it has never stopped anyone in IOG, Cardano community members, pioneers and everyday dreamers who find themselves drawn to this project and all it offers the world, from making history. Our long term goal beyond seeing this grow from idea to final product with worldwide distribution and high production value would be to facilitate the onboarding and education of any mainstream entertainment professionals looking to create and interact with Cardano and it's vibrant community.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Multilingual multimedia outreach to business & trade organisations & members with content created by real world experienced business people
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Hello, thank you for visiting our proposal,

Bridging the Digital & Analog Worlds
This proposal is in essence to create a bridge between Cardono Catalyst and industry organisations, business advisors and entrepreneurs around the world.
These organisations could be general ones such as Chambers of Commerce and also industry specific organisations offering help, advice and support to members of their business community.
Educate & Give Use Cases
We also propose to identify potential synergies between different companies to create a new project where both entities would support each other to create new proposals.
While introducing the concept of catalyst, there would be an element of education about what we are calling crypto venture capital (CVC). The education would also include proposals as to how a particular industry all business could benefit by connecting with the cryptocurrency and blockchain industry to make their business more efficient and profitable.
Business Students
Another area where we were would proactively approach would be business students around the world who presumably are planning to enter the business world and may have ideas that could be launched on the cardano blockchain.
Corporate Advisors
We would also like to run an outreach campaign to accountants, company formation agents and lawyers because they are quite often a first point of contact by entrepreneurs looking to start a business enterprise.
People of Influence
In all cases of outreach, we will be looking for gatekeepers, or influencers to substantial groups and communities in order to efficiently get the message out to as many people as possible.
Multi-Lingual & Multi Country
To make this fully effective we would translate all of the current fund's challenges into various languages in order to inform each target country about the current opportunities. We would also give guidance as to how to apply from the currently running fund.
Thank you for reading our proposal, looking forward to responding to any queries.
Best wishes,
Carl Henry
To be Powered By: https://carlhenryglobal.com
Carl Henry Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/carlhenry/
 
Road Map/Action Plan

Create a country-by-country directory list of gatekeepers & professional advisors and approach them (Target 2,000+).
Help to build international Catalyst Town Halls from directory members.
Participate in Challenge setting to facilitate the acceptance of a wider range of business challenge types.

Publish Multimedia Reports on the progress of funded proposals.

12 Month Roadmap

Help to build international Catalyst Town Halls from directory members.
Create a virtual annual awards ceremony.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Use the Eastern Town Hall & targeted virtual events to establish and support a network of East Asian entrepreneurs.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


We want to reach the massive untapped potential of East Asian entrepreneurs. Meet them where they are, in their country, their language and their culture. The Eastern Townhall wants to establish a growing network of East Asian entrepreneurs. Where they can build knowledge, share information, connect and support each other. Thinking global, acting local.
PLEASE NOTE: TRANSLATIONS OF THIS PROPOSAL ARE AVAILABLE ON THE EASTERN TOWNHALL WEBSITE
Current Problems and Limitation
Recall a moment when you realised if you poked something, pushed it or moulded it, something new and interesting popped out the other side. We're here again and this time on a global scale. We, the Cardano Catalyst community are pioneers in a new mindset. A new way of governing and funding. But to make a dent in the universe we need entrepreneurs. People are willing to take a risk, to poke, to push, and to mould new ways of doing.
Reaching Entrepreneurs is difficult when language and cultural barriers exist. Local context may also have undeveloped startup funding programmes too. This can result in unrealized startup funding opportunities. Few East Asian entrepreneurs are aware of the opportunities and the technical, economic benefits of Cardano; Nor is there a full understanding of how to apply Cardano technology within local communities to address local market opportunities. We want to change that.
The Team
A collaborative effort, the team bring a wealth of cultural and technical experience to Cardano. We are all very active in Catalyst, and community groups across our ecosystem. We are a diverse bunch united by the promise of Cardano:
Yuta Yuta @yutazz - Japan: Cardano official ambassador, Community Co-Organiser, Catalyst Fund 2 Recipient, certified public accountant.
Yan Tirta @yantirta - Indonesia: Cardano Indonesia community wrangler empowering his local community with education and encouragement.
Mie Tran @mie.tran.0407 - Vietnam: English and International Business major with experience working with western businesses and translation.
Andy Sibuea @zicozibu - Indonesia: Leading blockchain education beyond cryptocurrencies and across Indonesia.
Tim O'Brien @tobrien - Vietnam: No-code pioneer. Facilitator in East African Townhall (EATH).
Greg Bell @grebel - Australia: IT consultant, writing Catalyst Challenges.
Seomon Blub @seomon - Austria: IT consultant focused on the people-ware infrastructure for sustainable communities.
Robert O'Brien @wolstaeb - New Zealand: Financial systems Software Engineer, Community Co-Organiser and Entrepreneur.
Stephen Whitenstall @swhitenstall - England: Tracks and documents Catalyst. Helping communities like Catalyst Circle and Catalyst Swarm organise.
Felix Weber @felixweber - France: Community Manager building bridges between people. Member of the T&M Catalyst Circle/Swarm/School.
We are working with Venture Centre[1], IdeaFest[2], and Catalyst School[3]; as part of the proposal, we aim to work with Enterprenerdy[4], Emurgo[5], local Universities, and IOG's Catalyst Team.
Proposed Solution: Cardano StartUp Week
This proposal is about running virtual events in January/February 2022 to develop entrepreneurs in Vietnam and Indonesia. The event aims to upskill entrepreneurs to develop market opportunities based on Cardano.
The purpose of the event is to build startup founders and Distributed Autonomous Organisation (DAO) collaborators. We are not building startups! Our intent is to educate. Focusing on experience-based learning by providing a soft way for the general public to access entrepreneurship and blockchain technology without risk.
The event will happen over four weeks:
Virtual Networking (Week 1 & 2): The first two weeks of the event is about Networking. Getting registered participants to meet each other, discuss their ideas and aspirations. Tutorial sessions will be held to help upskill and familiarise people with business design tools.
Pitch and Team-Up (Start of Week 3): All participants come together for the opening event where individual participants can give a 60-second pitch of a project idea they want to pursue. People vote with their feet by choosing to join a team.
Learn and Work (Week 3 & 4): Over the next two weeks, teams start working together. Mentors are assigned. Special sessions are run with experts. Teams are encouraged to validate their ideas with potential customers. Throughout the two weeks, each team will have four 30min pitch sessions with a panel of mentors that help them refine their pitch and Catalyst Proposal.
Pitch (End of Week 4): All participants come together for the closing event. The pitch! Each team is given five minutes to present their market problem and their solution to a panellist that ask questions. To pitch every team must have submitted their proposal to Catalyst. When all presentations are given the audience will pick the winning teams. Prizes will be awarded. We all celebrate! At the conclusion of Fund 8, Catalyst Voters choose who to fund.
The event will focus on Cardano Blockchain solutions and place emphasis on using Business Model Generation, Customer Development approaches and the use of analytical tools like Lean Startup, the Platform Design Toolkit, and Wardley Mapping.
By the time proposals are submitted in Fund 8, entrepreneurial teams will have formed, worked together, finished customer testing, and developed robust business models.
What Success Looks Like
The event is planned to finish on conclusion of the second week of Catalyst fund 8, Feburary 2022. Teams will be submitting proposals to Catalyst Fund 8 as part of their work.
At the end of the event, at least 15 teams have managed to complete the process and submitted proposals to Catalyst Fund 8. Individuals complete the event with new skills, connections, and inspiration to continue their Cardano journey.
Key Performance Indicators
For Entrepreneurs Startup Month, participation:

Reaches 100 individuals that form into at least 20 teams.
At least 15 teams submit proposals.
At least 3 proposals that are funded in Catalyts Fund 8/9

At the end of the event:

We have increased our social media presense by 1000 followers.
The event is covered by four major media outlets.

After One Month:

Event Team formed, project plans and budgets finalised.
Event Website and Social Media Accounts established.
Event Online registration setup.
Event Promotional content (blogs/video) developed.
PR and promotion of the event started.

After Two Months:

Mentors, Judges and Registrations all confirmed
Event underway and is being run.

After Six Months:

First event successfully completed and we are planning another improved event.
Three teams have turned into three funded projects that are activily building on Cardano.

After Twelve Months:

The Cardano Start Month/Week is an established event on the Asian Cardano Calendar.

Intellectual Property
All our source code is licensed under the Apache License 2.0 - see our LICENSE file for details. Our published content is licensed under the Creative Attribution-Non-Commercial-ShareAlike (CC BY-NC-SA) License v4.0.
Budget
Please see attached proposed plan for a detailed budget breakdown with planned activities.

Core Team $10,500 USD: including project management, content production, comunity management, and adminstration.
Supporting Team $3,500 USD: Mentors, judges, special guests.
Marketing and Communication $5000 USD: Media Visit, Influencer collaboration, Google/IG ads
Contingency (%5): $1,000 USD

Attachments
The following attached document is the in-depth overview of the following; What Success Looks Like, KPIs, Roadmap, Milestones and Budget.
References
[1] Venture Centre: https://www.venturecentre.nz/
[2] IdeaFest: https://catalyst-swarm.gitbook.io/catalyst-swarm-genesis/july-2021/catalyst-idea-fest-july-2021
[3] Catalyst School: https://linktr.ee/CatalystSchool
[4] Enterprenerdy: https://entreprenerdy.com/
[5] Emurgo: https://emurgo.io/

Describe your solution to the problem


Organizing effective hackathons regularly twice a month; informing candidates and select the top 5 brilliant projects.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Organizing 48 hours hackathons which will be conducted once a month in different incubation hubs, providing the participants with a good amount of information about the Cardano blockchain and features it supports, the Cardano project catalyst and town halls, business cases examples that are compliant with Cardan's targets, and brainstorming sessions in contextualizing the use-cases into their startups.
Video record the events to share on different platforms.
Have juries with sharp eyes for win-win-type business cases, to filter the top 10 projects from each hackathon.
Reward the top ten project startups in items and/or cashes.
 
12 Months Budget plan:

Event date expenses: 21,600 USD for 12 hackathons of two days (900 USD per day, juries, and coordinator per dime, even hall rent two days per hackathon)
Rewards for each project: 100 USD worth of items or cash
Total reward expense: 12,000 USD for the top-ten 120 projects out of the 12 hackathons in a year.
Hackaton marketing and media expenses:  1,200 USD for a year
Fairly short Video and photo recording of the events: 200 USD per hackathon;  1,200 USD

The total expense to run this project for a year is 37,800 USD
Success Measurement:

Picking 120 practical project plans to the catalyst
More than 50% of the ideas funded by Cardano
The participants become active community members at the project catalyst and town halls

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


We aim to develop an educational social media account with a fresh graphic style to deliver a more unique image of the Cardano brand.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Various studies have shown that audiences ​lose their attention after seven seconds. Visual creativity has the power to engage and attract new users. In general, graphic design in the cryptocurrency and blockchain space is a very similar style, which causes visual fatigue.
Since we aim to target and recruit new followers of Cardano, we need to think strategically about user behavior. The user journey usually starts with awareness (engagement), then perceptions are changed (users learn more), and finally, affinity is achieved (users become proposers). 
 
HOW IT WORKS
Social media is a great way to deliver the latest Cardano projects and encourage adopting initiatives developed in previous funds. We have seen many ADA creators use meme images to enhance ADA's exposure. We also have a great community, and members support most ADA topics.
We will work with talented illustrators with international experience to plan the social media calendar and editorial illustrations together.
We expect to deliver Cardano and Catalyst news innovatively, with a digestible visual style. Social media posts will be direct, straightforward, humorous, and inspiring. The objective is to reach more potential audiences and encourage higher engagement.
 
Social Media Monthly Calendar Plan to have:
Three quality posts every week. Each post will come with a series of at least five images.
 
Budget Proposal

Co-op with 1-2 illustrators to create editorial content | $3,000*6 months = 18,000
Social media push | $200 per month*6 months= 1,200
Digital Marketing Coordinator | $800*6 months= 4,800

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Create a global buzz through an international amplifier, Times Square, via interactive DOOH campaigns to enhance awareness of Cardano.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


To attract entrepreneurs from outside the Cardano community, we need to grab their attention. Times Square represents the most vibrant commercial project on Earth, guaranteeing exposure.
Our organization specializes in conducting interactive digital out-of-home (DOOH) campaigns on Times Square. We are proposing to develop a similar campaign for Cardano ADA to be screened on Times Square billboards.
This exposure will incentivize young entrepreneurs to invest in ADA. We will provide ADA proposers with the opportunity to select the most compelling ideas for funds 7 and 8. We would also encourage young entrepreneurs to endorse the Cardano community and share the campaign on their channels. 
Interactive DOOH Campaign
Phase 1
To start, we will launch an interactive DOOH campaign countdown clock for funds 7 and 8 to generate a buzz.
Phase 2
During phase two, we will show the real-time status of the submission using dynamic graphics to make the process more fun, competitive, and exciting.
Cardano's official social media account can post the billboard live feed to amplify the event.
Phase 3
Finally, in phase three, we will announce the most exciting ideas of 2021.
 
Budget in Total  USD 56,000
30 secs Creative content*3 = 6,000
Times Square Interactive Billboard*2 hrs = 50,000 (Include the photographer service for social media post/global press release)

30secs Creative A - Countdown clock: 5 mins every day for 8 days, 5mins*8days = 40 mins
30secs Creative B - Real-Time status: 5 mins every day for 8 days, 5mins*8days = 40 mins
30secs Creative C -the most compelling idea prize: 5 mins every day for 8days, 5mins*8days = 40 mins

Create here, in Moudon - Switzerland, a CardaSatellite point. Organize real live chats, in small groups to share ideas or fears of future
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Organize a bi-monthly discussions in a small concert hall here in Moundon - Switzreland (ragular dates, always same place) - around 20-30 people/session
Take the time to explain what are blockchains, how blockchains are already working in our society and the positive potential impacts.
I'm David Blanchet, a 50Y old guy, in import/export industry since too long! 
My hobby, since more than 20 years, is to organize music events. I deeply think during these very scyr times, Caradno can bring a positive message to people who are not yet clear with world changes.
Wish to share my vision of today and tomorrow's world with local people and why not, make this movement growing in the future.
To be explained to people during those sessions:
- what is the utility of cryptos and what is behind a crypto such as team people, project & aims (speaker: Youtuber i.e.)
- how Cardano is built, who is the owner, why Carano exists (speaker from Caradono Foundation ZRH)
- why the Swisspost is in (speaker from YUH or Swissquote)
- what is a wallet (speaker me)
- what is a DEX (speaker me)
- CDBC: what they are, which countries have launched a project, which is already working with CBDC etc.
 
Starting end of October, after the first 3 month of sessions, more people should enter in the new world.
I am not someone who comes from IT. So I would need to create a small team to create an application to:
- confirm their presence during the sessions
- confirm or not their interest in Cardano or cryptos 
- allow them to have a direct link with the YUH application 
- allow them to have a direct link with the YOROI/DEADALUS applications
- allow access to the vaccine certificate if needed (by these times, we never know...)
This last point may have impact on the funds request.
Today, funds are structured like this (and subject to be reviewed):
I considered that all speaker are coming for free as the aim of these sessions is only the "mass" adoption of cryptos.

Piece by peace the world will change:)

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A YT channel that partners with music, cooking, and other YT channels to explain how crypto works. Don't teach blockchain, translate it.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


The idea is separated into a three parts:
1. Gather a following by producing good crypto content and working with crypto projects in the space. Part of the first part is that I like to invest games which show people different crypto concepts. For instance, a card and dice game that explains IPFS or a drinking game that explains how centralized vs decentralized stores of value work or a drinking game that explains Bitcoin Mining. (an excellent three month goal would be to make over 100 videos and have over a thousand followers)
2. Leverage that following to earn collabs with non crypto content creators. Specifically ones with 200,000 to 500,000 followers. I believe that people dive into their interests on the internet so we must bring crypto to them - not in the main stream media, but in our internet communities. Then theme crypto concepts around their channel. If it's a guitar channel, then explain bitcoin mining by randomly picking a note to play on the guitar and have two guitarists dual it out to try to play the random note that keeps changing when they hit it. The goal of this outreach isn't to teach blockchain, many people already know the concepts fairly well. It's to translate it and show them how simple, easy to understand concepts can come together to create something powerful and liberating. (an excellent six month goal, at this phase, would be to partner with at least three youtube channels with followers between 100,000-300,000 and earn over 100,000 followers)
3. After the channel has grown and more people are starting to geniunely understand blockchain, I want to use the revenue generated from the channel to go towards setting up stake pools for underpriviledged communities. I want black communities to be able to generate enough money from their stake pools to hire their own police force. It may be small, but they're not going to hire people who will kill their kids. I want community run initiatives like local radio to put their savings into stake pools and allow people to delegate instead of doing charity. After people are educated, we can start to set things up for people and raise up the 99% (an excellent twelve month goal would be to create at least one decentralized organization behind a charitable cause)
*note, the goals referenced above would be much longer but I am guessing that receiving Project Catalyst funding from IOHK is something that might help attract a lot of viewers to the channel
 
I ask the funds for my project simply be a donation to my stake pool that you'd hold there for a year. I'd then use the money my pool generates to fund the content creation on top of side hustles. Would also be looking to grow the team if at all possible. On my own I don't need much, honestly. Maybe $50,000 a year and i can honestly get most of it on my own. What's cool about the money being handled through a Stake Pool is that it'll be very transparent. I will be using the money to purchase food, internet, and electricity while I make nonstop educational crypto content.
 
Success, for me, will be determined by follower count. While I think BitBoy cryptos success is probably well deserved, I think his channel has become quite the centralized party. Since it's hard to put a metric on success educating the entire globe, I think a good goal would be to become the largest cryptocurrency channel on the internet.
 
Launch date already happened because I've already started making videos.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Draft proposal

Describe your solution to the problem


The solution is to recruit young entrepreneurs with high motivation, raise them, and help them propose their new ideas to the next Catalyst.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Problem Statement (In detail)
Compared to the size of ADA holders, Japan has less involvement in the community, especially the number of Catalyst proposers. The reason is that most Japanese holders already have their main business and cannot afford to participate as proposers. In addition, they are getting enough rewards from staking. That's why they are not ambitious to raise funds in Catalyst. Therefore, it is difficult to increase the number of new Catalyst proposers from the current Japanese community.
 
Solution (In detail)
To increase the number of new Japanese proposers, it is necessary to attract new proposers who have plenty of time and are highly motivated to raise funds—for example, young entrepreneurs, including students on the outside. However, at present, Catalyst is not well known in Japan. Therefore, we will hold an online seminar to explain Catalyst's potential. And we will gather young entrepreneurs interested in Catalyst and support them to propose their new idea in the next Fund.
 
Related Experience (In detail)
We hosted an online meetup for the Japanese community at Pretix in July, attracting more than 100 participants. In that meet-up, for those who are not familiar with the potential of Cardano, I explained the mechanism of blockchain and the features of ADA in comparison with BTC and ETH. In addition, we attend the Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall Meeting every week to promote Catalyst. I am explaining the potential of Catalyst and how to participate there. And every time, 40 to 50 participants are gathered in the breakout room in Japan.
 
Team Members (Role)
Issa Ichikawa (Leader): Waseda University Student / Sophomore (Lecturer at the seminars)
Toshiaki Miyatake: IOG Japan Campaign Manager (Holding seminars)
Yuta: Official Cardano Ambassador, Fund2 Catalyst Proposed Fundraiser (Assistant at the seminars)
Masao Ichikawa(My father): Official Cardano Ambassador, Content Creator (Supervision of seminars)
Ranket: A community member familiar with cryptocurrencies (Supervision of seminars)
* Miyatake, Issa, Yuta: Support after the seminar
 
The Main Target is Young Entrepreneurs
Our goal is to increase Japanese Catalyst proposers, especially young entrepreneurs, including students interested in using blockchain. There are two reasons to make the main target a young entrepreneur.
First, since I am a sophomore, I can use various campus resources, such as club activities and entrepreneurship training programs, to approach students who want to become entrepreneurs.
Second, if young entrepreneurs can use Catalyst's resources, they have a high probability of succeeding in their business. For example, Catalyst can provide the following resources.
1, Catalyst funds proposers without investor connections
2, Catalyst gives various feedbacks of the proposer's ideas
3, Catalyst provide proposers with Cardano blockchain technology
If we can teach young entrepreneurs about the existence of Catalyst and how to use it, they will definitely participate as proposers.
 
How to Attract Young Entrepreneurs
To achieve our goal, it is necessary to approach a wide range of people who are even a little interested in Cardano ADA. Therefore, we take the following approach.
・ By holding online, we can gather participants from all over the country.
・ We will share the seminar archive with those who applied for the seminar from the event portal site. Therefore, even those who could not attend on the day can see the seminar contents.
・ The members who participated in this proposal are well known in the Japanese community and are connected to many SPOs. Therefore, we will ask them to spread our seminar.
・ At Waseda University, where I attend, there are several entrepreneurship training programs, and I have also participated. Since such programs have frequent events and lectures, we will also aim to cooperate with such programs. If we can work together, we can bring many students to our seminar.
 
Roadmap
Our strategy is divided into two. The main seminars attract new proposers from the outside. And the sub seminars activate the current community. Details of each strategy will be described below.
・ Holding the main seminars
We will hold a two-day online seminar every month using the event portal site and zoom. We are planning to hold a total of 4 times. And the first seminar will be held in November. After each seminar, we will recruit people interested in Catalyst proposers and create an SNS group with them. In that group, experienced proposers, including myself and Yuta, will fully support them from proposal to implementation in Catalyst and increase the number of Catalyst proposers.
・ Holding and continuing the sub seminars
1. Activities at the Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall Meeting
We attend Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall Meeting every week and promote Catalyst in our breakout rooms in Japan. We will continue these activities in the future.
2. Cardano blockchain promotion activities in rural areas
We will also work on promoting the Cardano blockchain in rural areas. We have already received a request for a lecture from the general incorporated association "Kittamu," which is working on regional revitalization in Yoshinogawa City, Tokushima Prefecture.
 
KPI
・ Gather more than 50 participants at each seminar
(We will gather all people interested in Cardano ADA, including students and young entrepreneurs)
・ Gather 5 or more new proposal participants in one seminar
(Increase 5 proposal participants, including team members, not increase 5 new proposals)
・ Increase the number of Japanese proposal participants by 20 or more in 4 months. 
 
Seminar Contents
Prat1 (Day1): "What is a Blockchain? What is a Cryptocurrency?"
・ Mechanism of blockchain
→ Review the blockchain mechanism for beginners while comparing it with cloud data
・ Characteristics of BTC and ETH
→ Explain the characteristics of BTC and ETH, which are typical examples of cryptocurrencies
・ Electrical problems and Scalability problems
→ Mention the problems facing BTC and ETH
・ Overview of Cardano ADA
→ Please give an overview of ADA, which can be a solution to these problems, and help them understand the potential of ADA.
By looking at Prat1, even those who were not interested in blockchain and cryptocurrencies will understand the potential of ADA.
 
Part2 (Day2): "The uniqueness of Cardano ADA, and The chance to start a business!!"
・ Staking pool and delegation system
→ Explain the staking mechanism unique to Cardano
・ Catalyst project
→ Explain the new concept of on-chain governance
→ Get to know that Catalyst has the best environment to start up your business
・ Comparison with ETH2.0
→ Explain the difference in performance and future potential between ADA and ETH 2.0
・ Catalyst proposal method
→ Explanation of the flow from proposal to funding and introduction of actual funding cases
By looking at Prat2, even those familiar with cryptocurrencies can understand the uniqueness of the Cardano ADA. Also, by understanding Catalyst's potential, we can attract young entrepreneurs, including students, as new proposers.
 
Budget
・Slide preparation for the main seminars=40h x 2 types x $ 15 per hour
・Slide preparation for the sub seminars=30h x 4 types x $ 15 per hour
・Salary of the main seminars=$ 250 x 4 times x 3 people
・Slide supervision of the main seminars=$200 x 2people
・Slide supervision of the sub seminars=$300 x 2people
・Salary of support after the main seminars=20h (monthly average) x 4 months x $ 15 per hour x 3 people
・ Environmental improvement for online seminars=$1,170
(zoom license=$220, zoom 100GB cloud rental=$60 x 4 months(Used to save the archive), headset=$300, webcam=$150, Krisp license=$70, Grammarly license=$140, greenback=$50)
Total Costs = $11,770
↓
However, the calculation of labor costs is just an estimate. Also, some team members suggested deciding the labor cost later. Therefore, in this Fund, labor costs other than proposal leader will be charged after Fund7.
Fund6 Total Costs = $6,370
 
Self-Introduction
My name is Issa Ichikawa.
I am a sophomore at Waseda University in Japan and plan to start a business related to Cardano blockchain. My father was one of the Official Cardano Ambassadors, and I heard about Cardano from him. When I heard Charles Hoskinson's speech at TED, I was so impressed with his vision and decided to start a business related to Cardano. After studying Cardano for several months, I am currently working as a presenter who lectures the basic knowledge of Cardano for beginners together with Toshiaki Miyatake: IOG Japan Campaign Manager.
I have two strong points in implementing this proposal.
First, I am good at explaining difficult content in an easy-to-understand manner, and the participants highly evaluated the past three presentations I actually gave. Since I studied blockchain from scratch, I understand the points that are difficult for beginners to understand.
Second, I'm familiar with the problems and needs of student entrepreneurs because I'm actually a student. Therefore, I can provide more appropriate support to student entrepreneurs than others. In addition, if this proposal goes through, I can share my funding experience with them. As a result, they will be able to imagine how to participate in Catalyst concretely.
 
ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー
 
提案の日本語訳（Japanese translation of the proposal）
タイトル
『日本人の若い提案者を育てる』
問題提起
日本コミュニティの問題点は、Catalystの提案者が少ないことである。その原因として、日本人ADAホルダーの多くは一般投資家であり、資金調達に意欲的な起業家ではないことが挙げられる。
解決策
解決策は、私たちがモチベーションの高い若い起業家を集めて、育成し、彼らが次のCatalystに新しいアイデアを提案するのを支援することである。
関連する経験
私はブロックチェーン起業家を目指している学生であり、日本のコミュニティでCatalystについて講義をした経験が十分にある。
 
詳細な計画
問題提起 (詳細に)
日本はADAホルダーの規模に比べて、コミュニティへの関与が少なく、特にCatalystの提案者が非常に少ないです。何故なら、現ホルダーの多くが既に本業を抱えており、提案者として参加する余裕がないからです。加えて、彼らはステーキング報酬を十分にもらっているため、Catalystからの資金調達に意欲的ではありません。そのため、現状の日本コミュニティの中から新しいCatalyst提案者を増やすことは難しいでしょう。
 
解決策(詳細に)
日本人の新しい提案者を増やすためには、時間にゆとりがあり、資金調達に意欲的な提案者、例えば、学生を含めた若い起業家などを外部から呼び込む必要があります。しかし、現在、Catalystの存在は日本ではあまり知られていません。そのため、私たちがCatalystのポテンシャルを解説するオンラインセミナーを開催します。そして、Catalystに興味を持った若い起業家を集め、次のFundで彼らが新しいアイデアを提案するのをサポートします。
 
関連する経験(詳細に)
私たちは今年の7月にPretixで日本コミュニティ向けのオンラインミートアップを開催し、100人以上の参加者を集めました。そのミートアップで私は、Cardanoのポテンシャルをよく分かっていない方に向けて、ブロックチェーンの仕組みとADAの特徴をBTCやETHと比較しながら解説しました。さらに、私たちは東半球タウンホールミーティングに毎週出席し、Catalystの普及活動に努めています。私はそこで、Catalystの特徴とその参加方法について説明しています。そして、毎回40〜50人の参加者を日本のブレイクアウトルームに集めています。
 
提案のチームメンバー(役割)
市川一茶(リーダー)：早稲田大学生 / 2年生(セミナーの講師)
宮武俊明：IOG日本キャンペーンマネージャー(セミナーの開催)
Yuta：公式カルダノアンバサダー、Fund2の Catalyst提案資金調達者(セミナーのアシスタント)
市川雅男(私の父)：公式カルダノアンバサダー、コンテンツクリエイター(セミナーの監修)
Ranket：仮想通貨に精通するコミュニティメンバー(セミナーの監修)
*宮武、一茶、Yuta：セミナー後のサポート
 
セミナーの主なターゲットは若い起業家
私たちの目標はCatalystの提案者増やすこと、特にブロックチェーンの使用に興味のある学生や若い起業家などの提案者を増やすことです。主なターゲットを若い起業家にする理由は2つあります。
1つ目は、私は現役の大学2年生なので、サークルや起業家養成プログラムなど、学内にある様々なリソースを使って、起業家を目指す学生にアプローチすることができるからです。
2つ目は、若い起業家がCatalystにあるリソースを使えば、彼らが起業で成功する可能性が高くなるからです。例えば、Catalystは以下のリソースを提供することができます。
1, Catalystは提案者に対して、投資家との繋がりなしに資金を提供してくれる
2, Catalystは提案者のアイディアに多様なフィードバックをしてくれる
3, Catalystは提案者にカルダノのブロックチェーン技術を提供をしてくれる
などが挙げられます。もし、私たちがCatalystの存在とその使い方を若い起業家たちに教えることができれば、彼らは間違いなく提案者として参加するでしょう。
 
若い起業家をセミナーに集める方法
私たちの目標を達成するためには、Cardano ADAに少しでも興味のある人に幅広くアプローチする必要があります。そのための方法を以下に示します。
・オンラインで開催することで、全国から参加者を集めることができます。
・イベントポータルサイトからセミナーの申し込みをしてくれた方には、セミナーのアーカイブを共有します。そのため、当日参加できなかった人もセミナーの内容を見ることができます。
・今回のこの提案に参加してくれたメンバーは、日本コミュニティ内でも知名度がとても高く、多くのSPOとも繋がっています。そのため、彼らに私たちのセミナーの拡散をお願いします。
・私が通う早稲田大学には、起業家養成プログラムがいくつかあり、私も参加したことがあります。そうしたプログラムは、頻繁にイベントや講演会が開催されているため、そうしたプログラムとの連携も目指していきます。もし連携することができれば、多くの学生を私たちのセミナーに集めることができます。
 
ロードマップ(事業計画)
私たちの戦略は2つに分かれています。 メインセミナーは、外部からの新しい提案者を引き付けます。 そして、サブセミナーは現在のコミュニティを活性化させます。 それぞれの戦略の詳細は以下のとおりです。
・メインセミナーの開催
イベントポータルサイトとzoomを活用して、2日間に渡るオンラインセミナーを毎月開催します。合計4回の開催を予定しています。そして、最初のセミナーは11月に行います。各セミナーの終了後に、Catalystの提案者に興味がある人を募集し、彼らとSNSグループを作成します。そのグループでは、私やYutaさんを含めた提案の経験者が、彼らの提案から実行までを全面的にサポートし、Catalystの提案者数を増やしていきます。
・サブセミナーの開催と継続
1. 東半球タウンホールミーティングでの活動
私たちは東半球タウンホールミーティングにも毎週参加し、日本のブレイクアウトルームでCatalystの普及活動を行っています。今後もこの活動は継続していくつもりです。
2. 地方でのカルダノブロックチェーン普及活動
私たちは地方でのカルダノブロックチェーンの普及活動にも取り組んでいきます。既に徳島県の吉野川市の地方創生に取り組む、一般社団法人"Kittamu"さんから講演の依頼をいただいています。
 
KPI(数値目標)
・毎回50人以上の参加者を集める
(学生や若い起業家を含めたCardano ADAに興味のある人全般を集める)
・一度のセミナーで5人以上の新規提案参加者を集める
(新規提案を5つ増やすのではなく、チームへの加入を含めた提案への新規参加者を5人増やす)
・4ヶ月間で日本人の提案参加者を20人以上増やす
 
セミナーの内容
Prat1(1日目)：「ブロックチェーンとは？仮想通貨とは？」
・ブロックチェーンの仕組み
→クラウドデータと比較しながら、初心者向けにブロックチェーンの仕組みを復習する
・BTCとETHの特徴
→仮想通貨の代表例であるBTCとETHの特徴を解説する
・電力問題とスケーラビリティ問題
→BTCとETHが直面している問題について言及する
・Cardano ADAの概要
→これらの問題の解決策になりえるCardano ADAの概要を説明し、ADAのポテンシャルを理解してもらう
Prat1を見ることで、ブロックチェーンや仮想通貨に興味のなかった、あるいはマイナスなイメージを持っていた人たちにも、ADAのポテンシャルが理解できるようになります。
 
Prat2 (2日目)：「Cardano ADAの独自性と起業のチャンス」
・ステーキングプールと委任制度
→Cardano特有のステーキングの仕組みについて説明する
・Catalystプロジェクト
→オンチェーンガバナンスという新しい概念を説明する
→Catalystには、起業家を目指す人にとって、最高の環境が整っていることを知ってもらう
・ETH2.0との比較
→ADAとETH2.0の性能や将来性の差を説明する
・Catalystの提案方法
→提案〜資金調達までの流れの解説、そして実際の資金調達の事例を紹介する
Prat2を見ることで、仮想通貨に詳しい人もCardanoブロックチェーンの独自性を理解することができます。また、Catalystのポテンシャルも理解してもらうことで、学生や若い起業家を新規提案者として呼び込むことができます。
 
予算
・メインセミナーのスライド準備＝40時間×2本×時給1500円
・サブセミナーのスライド準備=30時間×4本×時給1500円
・メインセミナーの給料=2.5万円×4回×3人
・メインセミナーのスライド監修＝2万円×2人
・サブセミナーのスライド監修＝3万円×2人
・セミナー後のサポートの給料=20時間(月平均)×4ヶ月×時給1500円×3人
・オンラインセミナーの環境整備=11.7万円
(zoomライセンス=2.2万円、zoom 100Gクラウドレンタル=6000円×4ヶ月(アーカイブを保存するために使う)、ヘッドセット=3万円、ウェブカメラ=1.5万円、Krispライセンス=7000円、Grammarlyライセンス=1.4万円、グリーンバック=5000円)
合計＝117.7万円
↓
しかし、人件費の計算はあくまで見積もりです。また、一部のチームメンバーからは人件費の決定は後回しでかまわないと提案されました。そのため、提案リーダー以外の人件費はFund7以降に請求します。
Fund6の合計＝63.7万円
 
自己紹介(おまけ)
私の名前は市川一茶と言います。
私は早稲田大学の2年生であり、Cardanoブロックチェーン関連での起業を目指しています。私の父が公式アンバサダーの一人で、Cardanoのことは父から聞いて知りました。TEDでのチャールズ・ホスキンソンのスピーチを聞いて、私はそのビジョンに大きな感銘を受け、Cardano関連での起業を決意しました。私はCardanoについて数ヶ月勉強した後、現在はIOG日本キャンペーンマネージャーの宮武さんと一緒に、Cardanoの基礎知識を初心者向けに解説するプレゼンターとして活動しています。
この提案を実行する上で、私には強みが2つあります。
1つ目は、私は難しい内容をわかりやすく言い換えて説明することが得意なことです。実際に私が行った過去3回のプレゼンでは、参加者から高い評価を得ることができました。また、私自身が0からブロックチェーンを勉強したため、初心者が理解しづらいポイントなども把握できています。
2つ目は、私が学生起業家たちの抱える問題や要望に精通していることです。なぜなら、私自身が現役の学生であり、起業家を目指しているからです。そのため、私は他の人よりも学生起業家に適切なサポートを提供できると考えています。さらに、仮に今回の提案を通すことができれば、私の資金調達の経験をセミナーの中で紹介することができます。これによって、セミナー参加者はCatalystへの参加方法をより具体的にイメージできると思います。
 
提案内容は以上になります、最後までお読みいただきありがとうございました!!

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Wikipedia with Monetization on Cardano!
With aligned incentives, fostering quick application of new technology instead of litigations.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Wkipedia with Monetization on Cardano!
 
Catalyst helps to form communities and drive innovation in the Cardano ecosystem.
If we want to bring proposers in from other areas, the best way is to bring the same solution to their domains.
Developing countries have huge opportunities to leap ahead in productivity, just by upgrading their technology to current standards. But resources and knowledge is often not available in understandable terms or their language.
What we propose is to start building an open knowledge base, like Wikipedia, but with the goal to replace patents as motivation to fund and curate our technological knowledge.
By crowdsourcing both prior art and infringement determinations, we can create a system where litigations are completely unnecessary, and instead help companies find the best available technology to help improve their products and manufacturing. 
 
This is very connected to my proposal for the Atala challenge, https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/BIT-Basic-Income-Token/367219-48088
Success Metrics
3 Months: We will build the core token functionality, as detailed in the BIT proposal. Publish progress reports on blog. 
6 Months: A prototype platform to publish and develop ideas. Catalyst integration?
12 Months: Integrate this solution in e-commerce platforms, that provide kickbacks to idea owners (affiliate like)
Budget: $6000
I hope to start developing full time for the Cardano ecosystem, on this and related projects.
Thanks for supporting my vision despite this rushed proposal :)
 
Come join the IP revolution!
 
Launch date: 
Blog: 1.10.2021
Prototype: 1.3.2022
E-commerce: 1.6.2022

Definition of Success 3 Months

Within 2 weeks of being notified of success

Performance based remuneration based on the success of the invested portfolio

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Attraction and adoption of blockchain technology for business models and a practical guide from the Cardano community.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


What is Innovatio Community?
The Innovatio community is aimed at entrepreneurs and developers in the services area, the community goal is to foster mutual collaboration, the emergence of new start-ups, and the adoption of blockchain technology to different business models.
The Innovatio community has a discord server, where members can make a brief presentation of themselves, self-assign roles (area of expertise), and start an entrepreneur networking.
On the server, you will find channels oriented to show emerging projects, search for collaborations, ask for help to solve a problem, publish freelance offers, blockchain technology adoption, business educational content, etc.
 
Catalyst's difficulties to attract entrepreneurs/developers from outside the blockchain world.
Project Catalyst seeks to improve the quality of proposals submitted in the following Funds and increase their visibility in the entrepreneurial community.
Currently, the Project Catalyst community is not attractive to entrepreneurs and developers outside the blockchain world due to the:
1) Lack of communities focused on the implementation of blockchain technology as a business value proposition.
2) Lack of incentives to attract projects and entrepreneurs outside the blockchain world to implement this technology.
3) Lack of simple and practical content/information to guide and attract new entrepreneurs/developers.
 
Key features of Innovatio's Community
1. Content and daily use of social networks to encourage entrepreneurs/developers to adopt Cardano Technology and join to the Community. (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter)
2. Interviews to Cardano community projects focused on showing the implementation of the Cardano technology as valuable implementation.
3. Community managers with general knowledge of the Catalyst ecosystem to refer members to other communities with different focus (Technical knowledge, governance, local DAOs, etc.)
4. Periodic activities in conjunction with other communities to encourage new proposals for the next Funds.
 
How will the Innovatio community achieve this proposal?
1) The community administrators will prepare daily multimedia content to be published on social networks, explaining blockchain technology and exemplifying it in real use cases, so the developers/entrepreneurs can see the potential and current use of this technology.
2) Discord community moderators will encourage the exchange of ideas and discussions of all kinds and guide members within the ecosystem.
3) The Innovatio community will be kept up to date with news on the development of Cardano and the activities of the other communities, to publicize them and encourage participation in the ecosystem.
4) The development of explanatory videos to understand the technology is very important to capture the attention of entrepreneurs/developers outside the ecosystem.
 
How does success look like?
1. Entrepreneurs and developers actively discussing business ideas and value propositions for both the ecosystem and the development of new start-ups.
2. Daily posts on social media to attract and engage new members to the community for promote and adopt the Cardano's technology.
3. Members interested in getting to know more Catalyst communities to get involved in the development of the ecosystem.
4. Periodic interviews with influencers and community projects to attract developers/entrepreneurs to use Cardano's blockchain technology.
 
KPIs
1) The number of verified members in the community.
2) Proposals submitted to Catalyst have arisen from the Innovatio community.
3) The number of mutual collaborations fostered by the community.
4) Proposals that have achieved success thanks to the support of the community.
5) Interaction and visibility of content on social networks and YouTube.
 
Breakdown Budget
1 Experienced Community Manager: 2.500$/mo x3 = $ 7.500
1 Graphic Designer for the Audiovisual Content: 2.500$/mo x3 = $ 7.500
Marketing and Branding Campaign: $ 5.000
Total Budget: $ 20.000
 
Social Networks
Twitter: https://twitter.com/InnovatioGroup
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/InnovatioFounder
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/innovatiofounder
Discord: https://discord.gg/tcrdaytKDg
Spanish Telegram Group: https://t.me/innovatiofinderesp
English Telegram Group: https://t.me/innovatiofindereng

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


We intend to incubate interest in the blockchain by educating them with daily zooms and assisting in proposal development with targets.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Please note: This is a continuing funding request! Originally funded in Fund4!
Please note: We did not have a chance during Fund5 to amend the Fund5 submission due to the closeness of Fund4 and Fund5.  We did receive overwhelming support for this project in Fund5. Sadly, we did not receive funding in Fund5 due to a lack of available funding left over in the proposer outreach category.
 
Goal:
The goal of this project to reach out to as many students/graduates as possible to raise awareness of Cardano and the opportunities that exist for both developers, professionals and business owners. We want to drive the targets to Project Catalyst and assist them in submitting ideas and earn Referrer fees (to be self funded). We also will deploy a website (request already sent to CF Foundation to request permission to use "Cardano" in the website name using a .org extension).
Addendum: A clarification, we plan to request additional funding for a few months until we can be self-funded. During these next few months, as we introduce student and graduates to the Cardano ecosystem, we hope to help candidates develop Catalyst ideas; Steer them through the process of developing ideas and refining them for submission to the project thereby earning Referrer Rewards. When this conduit matures, we will be able to sustain the project without further funding from the Project (ideally by Fund8).
KPI:
1. Number of people Engaged (200/day, responses, learning, referrals)
2. Number of people Attended (100/day Zoom/Twitch)
3. Number of Ideas Submitted. (30 per Fund, adjusted from 100)
 
Campaigns:
Social Media: Twitter, Telegram, Zoom etc. Daily Twitch Streams
Email: Lead Nurturing and CRM During lead nurturing we will continue to engage the targets by drip marketing and steering them to learning resources that will be helpful in ensuring their adoption of the ecosystem. A sample drip would include a short 1-2 min video with the learning resource of the day. A link to register to twitch stream/zoom call. A reminder email/text sent to the target 15 mins before start and at the start of the call.
Incentive Program ADA Airdrop to student association presidents, participants; introduces them to Daedalus, broadens adoption, incentivizes

• Social Media Campaign $1000

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Expand the variety of alternative methods of access to med professionals by constructing a cardano-based direct physician to patient portal.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Cardano currently hosts large platform medical enterprises such as AskTheDoctor. It is my opinion that, if the stated goal is maximal adoption, it would do well to focus efforts on attracting independent medical practitioners and small practices. 
In my interactions with hundreds of doctors over the past seven years, and in particular within my close circle of confidants, a common thread has been the frequent expression of wishes to be free of the need to be employed by academia or large corporate practice, which increasingly represents the totality of available employers. The emotionally taxing and physically draining bureaucratic dehumanization one often contends with in these environments is no secret these days. Unsurprisingly, burnout is a scorching epidemic in the medical field, as readily available data in major medical journals (as well as copious personal experience) shows. The bottleneck keeping miserable doctors in their toxic circumstances is largely financial. In recent years, the business and regulatory environment of medicine has reached levels of such complexity and cost that the independent medical practice is now rapidly becoming an antiquated concept - to the detriment of both doctors and patients. Medical school debt of exorbitant principle and usurious interest is also a ubiquitous factor weighing heavily into these painstaking tradeoffs involved in taking or remaining in such personally unfulfilling jobs.
It seems clear to me that, if there were a simple way to supply a doctor the ability to "hang their shingle" via a direct to patient online portal, maximally automating all the complex and costly processes, with a published up-front startup price tag, the demand would be astounding. 
In this regard, I am hoping to now pursue the development of such a practice platform for myself. I am a physician in a position to "take the leap," and I like the idea of it being an open and collaborative process, as this is a fundamental precondition for demonstrating proof of concept. Our strategies and struggles would be public information. Incompatibility and conflict with regulatory bodies is inevitable, and should be anticipated. With studied foresight, conceptual adaptation and continued growth is a feasible goal, as is maintaining the simplicity of the direct to consumer platform. It follows that successful execution of one such business plan, with concomitant execution of marketing and outreach strategies, will attract other physicians to take the leap, with the hopes of sparking a new front of novel, independent patient care offerings. 
I am aware there are many broad strokes in the above paragraphs, and many finer points and vagaries are worthy of addressing. I am open to further discussion and education.
project_definitions: Entrepreneur, Teacher, Other/Prefer not to say

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


We are aiming to build a club where we can bring university students from all over India and developing countries on board.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Cardonex is a club for university talent from start-up hubs like India and many other developing countries focused on solving some of the most pressing issues in developing countries with the help of Cardano's Blockchain and instilling a culture of product creation through project catalyst. We are planning to start with India and then expanding further.
 
Key features of Cardonex:
1. Weekly webinars
2. Conducting workshops about Cardano's infrastructure and Plutus.
3. Creating Student Ambassadors for Cardano in their respective universities
4. Conducting Hackathons for Cardano's Blockchain
5. Project Catalyst guidance
6. Encouraging universities to build stake pools.
7. Dedicated youtube channel with all the recording of events, webinars, etc.
 
How Cardonex will achieve this?
We will be achieving our goals in phases with keeping a focus on fund 7 and fund 8 in the short term and overall expanding the Cardano ecosystem in the long run. We will keep adding more and more as our club grows.
Phase-1: Getting students from different universities onboard by conducting live webinars and Q/A sessions about Cardano and its ecosystem.
Phase-2: Conducting live trainings and workshops about Cardano's basic infrastructure, Plutus and Project Catalyst.
Phase-3: Organizing multiple hackathons in the Cardonex club and get them all ready for project catalyst.
Phase-4: Best students will be made student ambassadors for Cardano in their respective universities to spread further awareness, getting more and more students on board, and encouraging university management to build stake pools. 
 
How does success look like?
1. We are aiming to reach a user base of at least 2k students by the EOY.
2. We are planning to bring at least 3 proposals for each fund by the winners of our hackathons.
3. At least five student ambassadors in different colleges before fund 7 in top tech universities.
4. Raising awareness about Cardano and Project catalyst among students.
5. Bringing hundreds of skilled student developers to Plutus Pioneer Program.
 
Why are we the right persons?
We both have gained a significant amount of experience of the Cardano's ecosystem, from running a stake pool [SKRPT] to developing a dApp on Cardano's blockchain (deqree.in) and as we are university students ourselves, we are very well versed with the tech student community in startup hub countries like India. Also, we are currently having an outreach of around 10,000+ tech students from different universities all over India, some parts of UAE, Sri Lanka, etc. through different channels like Discord, Telegram, WhatsApp, Reddit, etc. as we all are part of an online degree program in India's top technical institute.
 
Roadmap
We will be launching Cardonex in October 2021. Our primary focus for the upcoming months is on creating quality proposals for fund 7 and fund 8 in project catalyst by skilled university individuals with all the phases rolling out one by one for each fund.
 
FAQ
1. India is very skeptical about cryptocurrencies then how is it possible?
A. Govt of India has clearly stated they are completely open and encouraging about blockchain solutions in the country, they are just skeptical of crypto trading due to high volatility.
 
Expenses
$1000 - For promotion and marketing over different social media platforms
$2000 - For organizing Hackathons and Prizes
$2000 - For creating quality content and conducting live webinars and sessions.
