project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Community members will work closely with Deryck Lance to develop meaningful risk-management contracts and related business ops
contributor_name: Q U A S A R
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Deryck Lance has been a deeply engaged member of our community, entirely on a volunteer basis.  His expertise in the insurance field is not lost on us, though.  Let us make a community risk-management fund, accessible to the Cardano community for a small initial set of financial risk management contracts, leveraging Deryck's expertise in the insurance field.
Creating these initial smart contracts and application workflows in support of some of the most essential, lightweight use-cases for insurance and risk management, will create opportunities for liquidity providers to earn rewards for allocating a portion of their holdings to hold a portion of risk distributed across the purchasing pool. 
Making risk-management part of the Cardano portfolio of services will benefit the Cardano community by rounding out a brand that can play alongside traditional providers in this space, and meeting the market in geographic regions that other providers have not been able to serve.
 
Purchasers of these initial policies will guard against risk in ways similar to traditional insurance policies, but administering these policies using the shared resources of the distributed Cardano network will provide unique efficiencies, human workflow, and new opportunities to cover different kinds of risk scenarios than have been available in the past.  Policy fees will be contributed to the risk pool, and claims will be paid out of the risk pool after appropriate vetting and review through human process.
 
The distributed pool(s) of distributed risk will be an  source of revenue available to all holders of ADA, scaled according to the amount of funds they hold in the pool, and with the inherent statistical risks of payout balanced between many other providers in the risk-liquidity pool/fund.  The revenues returned will be the result of surplus built up on the balance of pay-ins and pay-outs on the fund.
 
I propose gathering a community-based effort to plan and deliver on this general vision, on a similar template with the rest of my proposals.  Perhaps it can be structures as an Insurance Cooperative.  Are you ready to  help bring decentral finance to Cardano?
 
Scope, budget and detailed project plans will be refined and determined through community-based process.  You can expect to self-organize with others in the community, serving various roles that may include the following and more.

Community-wrangler
Project planning and management
Smart contract development
UI workflow design and implementation
KYC
Insurance operations, customer service
Legal
Underwriting, Liquidity

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Africa-centric, micro-investment through a blockchain ADA wallet. Investment through a familiar practice known to Africans, that is farming.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


A detailed plan will be shown on the presentation to be attached
 
Executive Summary
 
Africans do not understand investment types that are not based on familiar economic activities. Wise Rabbit addresses that problem by creating a livestock-based wallet which is a normal farming practice and already a very popular, low input, and quick return on investment.
Africa's farmers also suffer from a lack of liquidity and investment due to an unstable, inflationary currency which is resulting in poor food security and low growth opportunities.
 
Inflation in Zimbabwe, our pilot project country, is at 56% which erodes any bank savings by farmers and also causes high-interest rates from banks.
 
It's impossible to create a valuable community business in this environment unless the trend is arrested by a stable, accepted store of value. Livestock is something Africa understands well and is good at animal husbandry.
 
Creating a livestock smart contract will immediately solve the financing of farm activities while driving the adoption of the Cardano network as a reliable store of value. All grant funding will be used to create a form of ADA agri-coin to drive the food security value chain and ecosystem.
 
Wise Rabbit is a one farm, one manager, several decentralized members, crowd-farming model.
 
Our Solution
 

Create the digitally tokenized Wise Rabbit farm.
Employ one manager, one payroll for staff, and crowd-farm with the investment of 4000 ADA virtual farmers.
Capitalize the token from the natural evolution of the rabbit herd, with one rabbit parent capable of producing 48 new rabbits each year in a linear calculation.
Option to re-breed offspring for further growth of rabbit herd.
Wise Rabbit ADA wallets to become the token for investment and sale of rabbit meat for profit.

 
Qualifications
Sacha Robinson  (proposer)

Founded a crowd-farm investment concept in Zimbabwe, in 2020, which began life with 30 pigs and it has grown to 600 pigs with plans to scale up to 5400 pigs in the new year.
200 virtual farmers, from 7 different countries, subscribed to Dung Beetle Farms Trust and raised the seed capital to begin a piggery farm.
All investors have access to the farm for verification and observation of processes and receive weekly video and  WhatsApp updates and electronic statements for their monthly payments.
Wise Rabbit anticipates the same investors will be keen to take up an ADA wallet especially as some of them are based in the USA, UK, Canada, South Africa, Bermuda, Australia where BLC knowledge has taken root.
Current Dung Beetle Farms Trust staff under their manager's guidance are skilled in animal husbandry and will be further trained on rabbit production too.

 
Anthony Jackson (co-proposer)

Software Architect (10+ years)
Business Consultant
Entrepreneur
African (proudly Zimbabwean)
Son of a Philosopher
An advocate of Liquid Democracy
Open-Source Developer

 
Anthony, the creator of CheCha (the ka-chink sound that change makes inside a piggy bank) will be the technical lead for Wise Rabbit and his proposed ADA currency voucher system will have great synergy value to Wise Rabbit's wallet adoption.
 
Statement of Need

Wise Rabbit ADA allows wallet holders to share Wise Rabbit farm profit and buy investments.
Wise Rabbit token aims to drive the ADA wallet user adoption across regular people, virtual farmers, investors through the intuitive and seamless integration achievable by the decentralized payments platform.

 
Project Activities

Develop Wise Rabbit ADA token. Token value will be based on auditable production and maintenance costs of that rabbit, which may include the field where it is located, its feeding, staff costs, and health.
Create a rabbit farm digital asset
Capture real-world production data of rabbit production
The simple registration process of a farmer, investor, and ecosystem suppliers.
KYC integration.
High security and auditable transactions
Options to cash-in and cash-out at end of a holding period.
For every Wise Rabbit token issued there is a rabbit doe backing it and its natural evolution and expansion through an average of 48 offspring (and more) every 12 months.

 
What is the work plan/approach?

Source development team with Blockchain experience
Develop and map Wise Rabbit ADA functionality
Develop whitepaper for Wise Rabbit
Develop simply user interfaces to capture;
- Business events that dictate the value of the token
- User subscription and reporting channels
- Can be as simple as a WhatsApp bot

 
Output from the project

Smart-contract based crowd-farming of rabbit production
Zimbabwe Cardano presence to drive ADA wallet adoption
Unique opportunity to create an affordable investment for local and diaspora Zimbabweans (3 million people strong)

 
Further outcomes

An opportunity for any un-banked Zimbabwean to use Wise Rabbit ADA assets as a means of payment.
Wise Rabbit Token (WRT) will induce third-party large producers of agricultural feed, accessories, plus other farmers to tokenize their businesses and create a Wise Rabbit ADA agri-coin ecosystem.
Token that will become a tool for decentralized finance in the agro-industrial market.
WADA will promote similar crowd-farm digital assets in other African countries after the pilot project, e.g. Wise Rabbit Ghana

 
Metrics

Whitepaper approvals
Business Events captures
The number of rabbits tracked in the system
Cost of resources managed through the system
Number of WRT investors
Funds total exchanged from fiat to WRT

 
Geographical Area Served

Zimbabwe

 
Timetable and Major milestones
Success tracking
 
Phase 1 ~ 4 Week

Developer recruitment
Whitepaper development of Wise Rabbit ADA

 Phase 2 ~ 8 weeks

Onboard data into a digital asset
Create and test registry, auditable production, and treasury
Simple WhatsApp bot that handles
- Registration / KYC
- Data capture of farm activities
- Performance reporting
- Investor meeting and commitment log

Phase 3 ~ 8 weeks

Marketing / Virtual Agri-Business Network Events

Phase 4 ~ 1 week

Agri-Business Development Events
Retrospection and Reporting

 
Business Development Events will serve as a business networking opportunity for investors, entrepreneurs, and developers to come together to work on new agribusiness ventures. They will continue indefinitely, and be hosted every month once we have a sufficient blockchain virtual community.
 
Expected Launch Date

The launch of the Wise Rabbit is expected 9 weeks after funding date.(April 2022)

 
 
Community or Cause

Investment and Retirement Nest Eggs - investments in livestock through digital tokens at a level that almost anyone can afford thereby impacting thousands across Zimbabwe and Africa in the area of food security and healthy eating.
Regular Stable Income - Wise Rabbit will be backed by rabbit production and natural growth of the prolific rabbit breeding cycles which promotes a quick return than most investment types.
Savings Culture - at 5 Dollars per unit, a community whose savings have been eroded over 2 decades of inflation, can now become virtual farmers interested in a real asset.
Collaboration and Social Impact - Through crowd-farming on rented fields, an agricultural ecosystem of investors, farmers, and buyers will create a cohesive and supportive community.
Accessibility - everyone can become a livestock producer without leaving their home, making Wise Rabbit widely and conveniently accessible from any keyboard in the world
Financing - peer-to-peer local funding support coupled with global investors to provide much-needed funding that is only possible in the distributed farming approach.
Employment and Entrepreneurial - A farm-gate sale of meat at wholesale prices to those who wish to buy and sell rabbit meat from their own vendor stalls and at the meat market.

 
Challenges

Regulatory Environment - Current government stance on blockchain will be a potential threat
Tech-challenged farmers will potentially slow the adoption of digitalized assets until they understand it.
Decentralized operations of any business will always be viewed with initial suspicion.
Auditability will be met with friction by farm staff and management as we migrate to a blockchain.

 
Risks and Challenge Mitigation

The government will be engaged and shown advantages and alignment to their own goals towards increasing inflows of foreign direct investment. It should be an easy sell after the recently publicized framework for foreign-based investment.
Tech capabilities will be enhanced through training. Africa's majority is already smartphone savvy and usage in Zimbabwe is already at 96%. Re-training to blockchain and digital tokens will be expected to be easy.
Tokenization benefits are desirable and possibly the only viable option to change farmer's fortunes in a country where bank loans are non-existent. Decentralization will therefore be well received after training workshops.
Random audits will come to be accepted for their value and continued assurance of investors. Management and staff will therefore get used to the audits as well as their indispensable need. Training will be given to show the bigger picture and existing world examples of the benefits of a tokenized business.

 
Team Qualifications
Sacha Robinson

Founder of Wutano - community network of more than 500 coordinated citizens and suppliers
Founder of Dung Beetle Farms (200+ investors from 9 countries and 600 pigs)
Zimbabwean as well as a farmer at heart and practice.

Anthony Jackson

Zimbabwean, born and raised in Bulawayo
Software Architect (10+ yrs)
Business Owner

West Africa Decentralized Alliance (WADA)
A skilled team of Cardano community practitioners and entrepreneurs, located in hubs across Africa and the diaspora.
WADA is looking to host hackathons in Zimbabwe, as part of the Planting Roots in Africa initiative, which Wise Rabbit proposers will be a part of to add to the ADA value chain and the community at large. The timely deployment of WADA and Wise Rabbit projects in Zimbabwe will make Cardano a household name, and ignite interest entrepreneurs to participate in Catalyst!
 
The Team - Social Links
Wise Rabbit is a digital token project, it is a Wutano Life Trust project headed by entrepreneur founder Sacha Robinson and co-founder Anthony Jackson who is a software developer.
 
Sacha Robinson
 
https://dungbeetle.co.zw
https://wutano.com/wutano-trustees
https://wutano.com/invest-in-wutano
 
Anthony Jackson
 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/anthonyza
https://github.com/expelledboy
https://betaplum.com
 
WADA -Digital Transformation For Africa
https://wadalliance.org
 
Applicant's most recent activities report
 
Sacha founded Wutano Trust which has an active project with an engaged user-base. Their business model is very inclusive, with an ever-growing partner network. Sacha Robinson will take a leading role in marketing and business development, leveraging his network and team to maximize the value proposition of Blockchain.
An existing, thriving piggery project was created with the crowd-farming method and gives us the confidence we can blockchain rabbit farming easily.
Sacha Robinson has an MBA degree in Business Administration, Higher Diploma in Strategic Innovation, 20 years experience as a business owner and director in blue-chip companies.
 
 
Budget Breakdown
Phase 1 => $8000

Recruit Team
Wise Rabbit Whitepaper

Phase 2 => $14000

Data import
Create and test registry, auditable production, and treasury ???
WhatsApp bot

Phase 3 => $5000

Market presence
Token sale event

Phase 4 => $3000

Investor and marketing event
Project report

 
--

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


A FREE USB STICK: An offline developer kit with selected Cardano resources aim at Internet-challenged regions for  new Cardano developers
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Cardano offers a ton of online developer content and resources, but this is largely inaccessible to regions of the world with limited Internet access. Many developers in these regions can't gain easy access to the content they need, have trouble streaming tutorials, or just can't download a  binary Node, library or software developer kit (SDK).
We Propose a  Cardano offline developer kit  that offers selected developer's resources aimed at Internet-challenged regions.
The Content of the USB will include  relevant developers material to get any developer started in those region such as : 

The entire Plutus Pioneer Program Resources
Full Cardano course videos on  (Haskell , Plutus , SPO , marlowe  ,  etc)
The entire Developer Docs Website: https://docs.cardano.org/
Testnet Exercises like Alonzo purple Exercises. 
Stable Binary version of Cardano Node for different Operating System
Cardano videos from the Cardano Developers YouTube channel etc
other 

These kits  will be distributed through Cardano Developer Communities  and Events in Sub-Saharan Africa, India, and Bangladesh. 
 
How does this proposal fit into this challenge?
How many DeFi developers did this community focused challenge bring into the Cardano ecosystem?
 
How will  the Cardano Developers Communities use this?
The Cardano Offline developer kit can be used in an number of ways  to bring more DeFi Developers into Cardano for instance

Hackathons: Instead of having attendees try to download Binary Node or Building from the Source and other installation files with a poor or non existent internet connection, attendees can make use of the SDK installation files for Cardano that are available with the kit.
Viewing parties:  Cardano communities Event Organiser  can use the videos to hold viewing parties , where  members of such local Cardano community , office or school can come together to view and discussion videos on specific  Cardano technologies . example  hosting an SPO class  videos.
Reference and self study: Developers can use the the documentation , SDK and videos that come with the developer kit for reference and self study at home or in the office , example studying the entire Plutus pioneer Program offline.
Hosted within local intranet: Local Cardano Communities can copy the content (docs, videos, installation files ) to a local server in a local intranet in a local tech hub, incubator, computer science lab or office. That way members , staff or students can have access to the content within their local intranet instead of needing internet access to use it.

 
LICENSE
-  The Resources in this Kit will be distributed under the Creative commons and Apache licenses to help everyone  spread it as far and wide as they want!
 
Definition of Success


Number of Free USB distributed  per week


        Number of updated resources added in each quarter.


Number of Cardona  event participant Receiving the Kit.


Success stories of what DeFi Project they are building with it 


Numbers of new Learners  Receiving the Kit in those Regions.


 
Risk/ Challenges
We have identify two  challenges in the implementation of this project.
1.   There is a risk of people selling the USB drive to Developers in remote region without our knowledge and this can lessen the real impact we  set to achieve.
2 There is also the challenge of finding ALL the weekly Cardano's Communities Event happening in the target region.
 
To solve the challenges, we will

  We will label All the branded Cardano USB drive with "NOT FOR SALE" boldly 
 we will collaborate with various Cardano Events  Listing platform and Community Organisers.
We will reach out to IOG technical committee for a newsletter mention
 We will design an On-demand  Request Form for Cardano Developers Community to request for the Kit.
We will make use of Premium delivery for Fast and On time Shipment.

 
IMPACT
As new developers and  team are building  DeFI projects in Cardano, one of the thing we can do as a community for developers in internet-challenged region is to help them SAVE COST during the learning phase of their Journey.
Poor internet network coverage for online courses can hinders so many developers in those region  and we know that talents are everywhere but opportunities and resources  are not.
Given them the resources to learn in offline mode would SPARK many ideas and local solutions for their region while others would have the technical Skill to be employ by company and startups using Cardano Blockchain.
Overall would increase the adoption and building DeFi projects in those Regions.
 
Roadmap
1. 1-3 months post funding
October:

 Purchase of  Cardona Branded USB Stick
 Creation of Community Request Form and  preparation of Promotion materials for the Kit
 Downloading and put together  resources  for Offline Usage.

  November: 

    Testing of all Resources / Video for offline usage 
     Adding Contents to Cardano USB drives 
    Testing in different operating System

   December

       On-Demand Distribution to Cardano Communities /Events in those Region
       Social media stories with hashtag and Impact tracking of the result.

4-6 months post funding

 Update of content and Resources
 testing of newer contents
 Adding of more Content to the USB drives
 On-Demand Distribution to Cardano Communities /Events/Hackathon Organisers in those Region

 
6 months to one year

 seek for more funding to buy USB drives
 Work local hub and University to setup Hosted Cardano Offline Content within local intranet

 
 
 
Pilot Expenses

Technical Project Manager: $2500 * 3 = 7500
2500  USB Stick : $12500
Branding and Labeling: $1000
Multiple Premium International Shipping  : $1500

 
Launch Date: December 2021
 
Who is Volibra?
Volibra is a small team of developers building merchant payment Infrastructure on Blockchain. The first product we plan to build on the Cardano blockchain is P2P Trading Protocol for the African Market. This P2P protocol is the first step of bringing our Merchant payment API from Diem blockchain to Cardano and a key to unlocking millions of Africans with cash and limited Strict access to banking services to adopt Cardano. (https://volibra.com/)
Our team consists of several Plutus developers, a front-end developer, and Infrastructure/DevOps Engineer. With these resources we believe we can develop a Workable MVP that can be used by hundreds, if not thousands, of Users. Our team is also part of the Alonzo-purple testing cohort and plutus pioneer Program.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Create stake pools & use the rewards as collateral with liquidity partners to secure the debt funds needed, give our own tokens as rewards.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Who we are?
We are Kashin; we are an up and running social credit reputation app for underbanked micro-entrepreneurs in Latin America, we give immediate loans between $12.50 and $125.
Our social algorithm sets credit scores so that users increase their credit line and reduce interest rates according to their own credit behavior and their first-degree referrals.
In 5 months operating we have these results:
- USD 25,000+ lent in 1,200+ loans from 1 to 4 weeks periods
- Average interest rate of 15%* and default rate below 10% (The system has 15% default and other micro-lending startups have defaults between 20% to 40%)
- +87 NPS points (Range: -100 to +100)
- Churn below 20% & ascending volume lent COHORT
We are one of the 20 finalists from the 500 Startups Acceleration Program sponsored by the Peruvian Government in July 2021.
Our team:
Jose Manuel, our CTO, was Tech and Data Regional Lead for Cabify - the largest Uber regional competitor.
Jose Francisco, our COO, was Project Manager at Cabify and a former E&Y Consultant.
I am the CEO, before I was the Regional Manager of Cabify, before I was a Consultant at McKinsey, & Credit Analyst at HSBC
We have as mentors: The Chief Transformation Officer of Rappi, the CEO of EmCasa, the Chief Growth Officer of MuniTienda.
 
Why do we do this pilot?
Controlling default rates in microlending with small interest rates is very hard, but we are being very successful in that aspect with our disrupting social algorithm, we are the pioneers scaling social credits with technology*. But securing debt funds to escalate our loans to more people and geographies is our next challenge. We are Cardano advocates for a while ago and MELD inspired us to leverage stake pools engagement for a higher purpose while making a good investment for ADA holders.
With this pilot, we want to test our hypothesis that we can engage ADA holders to stake with us and achieve the goal of limitless funding for our micro-credits because without the collaboration of the ecosystem this wouldn't be feasible.
 
Deliverables:
1. To validate the engagement of the Cardano community with our project, we will create and evaluate the performance of two stake pools:
- One stake pool with 100% rewards support
- One stake pool with 50% rewards support
Deadline: 1 month from funding.
 
2. To be ready to distribute our reward tokens once we officially launch, we will define the legal framework for the retribution of our tokens to our stake pool supporters.
Deadline: 3 months from funding.
 
Challenge success & KPIs:
If our pilot succeeds, we will move forward switching our company funding strategy to Cardano so we will be one more Fintech using Cardano's DeFi ecosystem. Our pilot will be successful if:
After 1 month:
- We have the 2 stake pools up and running
After 3 months:
- We have more than 500 ADA holders staking in our stake pools
- We have more than 1M ADA staked in our stake pools
 
Budget:
- 100 hours of Senior Dev: $3,000
- Legal assessment fees: $3,000
- 2 Raspberry pi: $380
- 2 Solid state drives: $120
 
Partnerships:
- MELD has successfully launched the first ISPO (Initial Stake Pool Offering), with over 270M ADA staked in their stake pools. We are on track to a long-term partnership for them to provide us liquidity from 2022 onwards.
- Vent is supporting us in the legal & tokenomics for our launch to market. We aim to give a clear utility purpose and create value for our token holders with the progress of our ecosystem.
 
Find attached our draft for the token business model to understand the value creation flow.
 
*Our protocol is set at 5% profit, and we are working on automatizing interest rates for all our different user clusters.
 
[WE ARE UPDATING OUR BRAND & WEB PAGE IN THE UPCOMING WEEKS, PLEASE EXPECT OUR LOGO TO BE DIFFERENT TO THE ONE FIRST POSTED IN THE PROPOSAL]

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Social site 4 fractional ownership without need of smart contract = per-NFT stakepool. Staked 'bids' earn and grow until seller gets excited
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Pay for development of a framework that can be rebranded by anyone wishing to be a Site Owner.
These are turnkey profit machines based on fan appreciation of NFT artists or families of NFT within a genre. The framework is a website that manages a few interactions with the Cardano Blockchain to maintain a membership community from sale to merchandise.
Like Fantasy Football, Fantasy Bidding allows fans of a particular NFT to gather socially around it, in a setting where they can add to the overall purchase 'purse'. NFT fans also need a place to congregate around their favorites directly.
My premise is a stakepool for every NFT that fans would 'like' to own but cannot afford to win at auction. By contributing to a stakepool 'for' a particular NFT, any number of individuals can 'contribute' to a winning bid. Until the sale is achieved, the staked ADA continue to gain rewards for the 'bidders'.
At some point in the future, there may be an auction that the entire amount in the pool will be enough to win, or the owner of the target NFT is eventually impressed with the amount, and executes a sale.
The transfer of token ownership goes to the Site Owner's wallet and it is held 'for' the group of collected bidders. They will be proportionally paid at the time of "total sale" when the NFT token is transferred to another entity.
Until there is a "total sale" (100% consensus) the actual NFT token remains in the Site Owner's wallet, and members can exchange ownership at a 1:1 ADA ratio.
From the original purchase, to the eventual sale, ownership is constantly in flux, and Fan bids are always active. 
While in the Site Owner's wallet, ALL fractional owners have equal individual rights to use, but not licensing. Proceeds from any licensing contract are the property of the NFT and pay out to all current owners only. When ownership changes out of The Site, terms of use are up to the owner.
The Site does not deal in exchanging ADA for any other currency, but performing wallet functions for users interested in a 
"single home experience" is of interest.
Profit comes from overall stakepool rewards, and small % fee on sales.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Open source protocol for users to mint synths that track the price of real world assets using Plutus smart contracts and oracle price feeds.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Preface - See what Indigo Protocol has already accomplished for the Web-app:

Meet our CEO and CIO Here:

View Indigo Protocol technical documents and updates:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1WAEzs7gmyIAziiiHvapN89Fjmzs88fKN?usp=sharing
View Our Other Proposal Here:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Plutus-PAB-Typescript-SDK/368540-48088
#What is Indigo?
Indigo allows the creation of fungible assets, "synthetics", that track the price of real world assets (Stocks, ETFs, commodities). Indigo synthetics are intended to be used as money legos in Cardano DeFi protocols, and to unlock liquidity across the world's assets, all on-chain.
#What is a synthetic asset?
A synthetic asset is simply a tokenized derivative that mirrors the price of an underlying asset. Imagine that you want to trade BTC shares without holding the BTC asset itself. Using a synthetic, you can trade iBTC (Indigo Synthetic BTC) instead, which fluctuates in price identical to the underlying asset by tracking and continuously updating its price feed using data oracles.
#Relevant Experience
Indigo Labs is a software development company. We are a team of developers and consultants with Plutus and DeFi domain expertise. Our devs have completed the Plutus pioneers program, are in the top 20% of Plutus contributors on GitHub and are active members of the Catalyst community. Our consultants bring a balance of fintech, DeFi and product development understanding to the Indigo protocol and we are using this experience to build a composable DeFi protocol 'money lego' for the entire Cardano ecosystem. To get in touch with our team or learn more about us, please visit https://indigoprotocol.io/.
Kikai Tech is a software engineering research & development team specializing in functional programming, Blockchain and AI. Kikai's list of partners include Cardano DeFi lending protocol MELD as well as AI focused firms Vizgard and Nobi. 
 
#Deliverables
-Deploy the Indigo v1 contracts to the Alonzo testnet when full smart contract functionality is made available.
-Deliver the Indigo v1 contracts and SDK at the time as Goguen mainnet. The v1 will include full protocol functionality and enable users to mint iAssets that track the price of real world assets using Plutus smart contracts and oracle price feeds.
-The final report of the Plutus smart contract security audit will be made publicly available.
-Weekly development progress reports will be submitted to the Cardano ecosystem (this has already begun).
Our definition of success is accomplishing each of the deliverables highlighted above on time and on budget. 
#Indigo Development Timeline
Week 33 - Aug 23rd - 29:
- Finalize all Indigo-related Web Application Functionality
- Simulations built for all contracts
- Implement DEX functionality into web application
Week 34 - Aug 30th - Sept 5th:
- Internal Security Audits
- Finalize Technical Documentation
- Prepare for internal testnet deployment
Week 35 - Sept 6th - 12:
- Continue Internal Security Audits
- Simulation and modeling of economic attacks
- Deploy to internal testnet **
Week 36 - Sept 13th - 19:
- Continue simulation and modeling of economic attacks
- Deploy bug fixes to internal testnet **
- Prepare for public testnet launch
Week 37 - Sept 13th - 19:
- Continue simulation and modeling of economic attacks
- Deploy bug fixes to internal testnet **
- Prepare for public testnet launch
- Submit code to Tweag for Audit
Week 38 - Sept 20th - 26:
- Deploy to public testnet
Week 39 - Sept 27th - Oct 3rd:
- Deploy bug fixes to public testnet **
- Finalize PAB TypeScript SDK
- Build Mainnet Launch plan
Week 40 - Oct 4th - 10:
- Continue bug fixes on public testnet
- Review and implement fixes for Tweag Audit
Week 41 - Oct 11th - 17:
- Continue bug fixes on public testnet
- Review and implement fixes for Tweag Audit
Week 42 - Oct 18th - 24:
- Deploy Indigo Protocol to Mainnet
** Dependent on progress of Alonzo Hard Fork Event and IOHK's PAB development progress.
#Metrics/KPIs
-Lines of on-chain Plutus code developed per week.
-Number of Github repo pull requests per week.
-Total lines of code developed (on-chain and off-chain) during fund6.
-Number of issues resolved during the security audit. 
# Budget/Resource Breakdown
We have divided the budget out across all deliverables and costs including VAT:
The Haskell security audit team will dedicate approx. 65 engineering hours to complete the Plutus contract security audit and 2 full time Haskell engineers.
30 engineering hours - Code Review
15 engineering hours - Delivery of Initial Audit Report
15 engineering hours - Verification Review
5 engineering hours - Final Audit Report
Fixed cost for this work which is composed of developer's salary, accounting/taxes and VAT: $60,000

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Create a learning environment for Devs and Entrepreneurs looking to create and scale DeFi businesses, find a team and submit proposals
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


Main Deliverable:
Pilot: A 6-week training program focused on:
- The basics of DeFi
- The Cardano DeFi Landscape
- Current Projects and Success Stories
- How to find a team for your DeFi idea
- How to get your DeFi project funded with Catalyst
--------------- IMPACT -----------
How does this proposal fit into this challenge?
Helping DeFi teams scale over the next 6 months must include an element of education and collaboration.
How will this campaign add value to our ecosystem?
By providing a platform for Devs and Entrepreneurs who are both inside and outside of the Cardano ecosystem to learn how DeFi can be applied and scaled. This means more talent is brought in, more projects are created and more innovation takes place, where teams are sharing knowledge, collaborating and receiving expert advice.
Outlook and future challenges?
The end-game for this proposal is a learning and collaboration portal solely focused on the DeFi ecosystem within Cardano. This will be done, first, with a pilot program of 25 applicants, then with a larger pilot, and finally with a new cohort every 3 months who would follow a well-defined, but ever-evolving curriculum for 'DeFi for Cardano'. 
This will be split into a 3-phase proposal process to gauge the community's ongoing support for this initiative and to ensure fiscal sustainability.
------------ FEASIBILITY------------
Reference (Past Successes):
WADA is already building a learning management system (LMS) as well as a membership platform, where new DeFi teams can be onboarded, trained and access the network resources, including developers, designers and software architects.
Currently, there are Haskell and Plutus curriculums under development at WADA as well as a proposal for multilingual support, catering to those in French and Arabic-speaking countries. There is also a Catalyst Virtual Startup Bootcamp that will run in conjunction with this program and aim to support it through access to team members, proposal editing and business advice.
Roadmap:
After successful funding:
First 60 Days:

Build the curriculum, with videos, documents and presentations
Confirm educators and speakers, review the material they will present
Engage WADA technical and design team to build out the platform, upload content and create graphics and illustrations
Launch a 15-day marketing campaign targeted at DeFi teams and individuals both inside and outside of Cardano
Open application process for 20 days

Next 30 Days:

Review applications and conduct interviews where relevant for 16 days
Announce successful applicants 14 days before launch
Pre-reading documentation handed out for blockchain fundamentals

Launch Program (Feb 15th):

Weekly learning sessions with hand-outs, tasks and activities
Fortnightly office-hour with DeFi experts
Proposal workshops in collaboration with WADA
Saturday Swarm Sessions for team planning in collaboration with Catalyst Swarm

Post Launch:

Survey to determine pilot's success
Ongoing proposal support and funding advice
Invitation to DeFi mentoring program
Catalyst proposal for Phase 2

 
Core Team & Roles:
Josh F - Project Coordinator and Finance Lead @ Wada
Sidney - Diaspora Lead @ Wada
Mercy - Coordination Lead @ Wada
Megan - Education and Events Lead @ Wada
 
Main Stakeholder: WADA (https://wadalliance.org)
Other Stakeholders:
A range of experts, educators and DeFi businesses that will provide training sessions, office hours and technical support. For formal education backing, we are already in contact with:
Frankfurt School of Finance & Business Management - Blockchain Center and Thinktank (https://www.frankfurt-school.de)
University of Nicosia - MSc in Cryptocurrency and Blockchain Education since 2013 (https://www.unic.ac.cy/)
Relevant Partners:
Blockchain Education Network (BEN), providing access to thousands of prospective students ready to be trained and onboarded
PATF who run quarterly blockchain events with previous topics including AI, DeFi and Supply-Chain Management
Catalyst Swarm who are the foremost leaders in Catalyst collaboration and facilitation
Budget breakdown:
Team fees $8000
Curriculum Development $4000
Platform Costs $3000
Incentives $2000
Marketing $1000
-------------AUDITABILITY------------
What success looks like:
At least 2 successfully funded DeFi proposals and 80% approval rating of the program by the pilot program attendees. Recommendation rating of over 50% and at least 3 members who sign up for the post-pilot DeFi mentoring program. 

3 months: Program Launched with materials created, platform developed and speakers confirmed
6 months: Progam Completed with the above success criteria met
12 months: Second-launch with a larger cohort and a more established learning path

Key Metrics:

No. Applicants  (Team and Individual)
No. Completed Program  (Team and Individual)
No. DeFi teams created
No. Proposals Submitted
No. Proposals Funded
% Proposals Submitted / Program Members
Approval rating in %
%  Recommend the program

Risk Management:
Level of interest: Interest will be gauged by the voters and community members throughout Fund 6
Timelines until launch: No delays are expected given the length of time (60 days) to build the curriculum is reasonable.
Quality of education: WADA is currently delivering multiple educational programs, created by teachers and software developers. Their partners (BEN) are also seasoned educators with an already well-established membership and training platform.
Quality of proposals: WADA and partners are long-time Catalyst members with several successfully funded proposals, as well as assisting others on their Catalyst journey.
Future sustainability: Ongoing training and onboarding for the cohorts after Phase 3 will come from membership fees, sponsorships, investors and referral bonuses.
 
Affiliated Proposals:
Catalyst Virtual Startup Bootcamp:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Catalyst-Virtual-Start-up-Bootcamp/366770-48088
Defi and Microlending for Africa:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/DeFi-and-Microlending-for-Africa/369449-48088
WADA Outreach Program:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Scale-up-WADA-s-Outreach-Program/366982-48088
WADA Proposer Workshops:
https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/WADA-Proposer-Workshops/366968-48088
 
Project brief: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GvtNNmqTId1tPoxgHEGLvjnYma2GO_M4ev14mIfZers/edit?usp=sharing

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Dragon Defender is an automatic scalable system that has been fighting spam for 10 months with a selected no. of Cardano YouTube Channels.
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


www.DragonDefender.com developed over the past 10 months and has been undergoing lots of testing with real YouTubers, and is now what we would call at MVP (minimum viable product) level. https://www.dragondefender.com
The system is comprised of multiple backend nodes that are centrally controlled by a cloud service and presented to the users with a web frontend.
The independently running nodes scan an on-boarded white list of YouTube channels and using a comment matching algorithm (that has been fine-tuned over 10 months) detects and removes 95% of spam messages and 99% of YouTube channel imposter's messages.
The cat and mouse fight never stops
Dragon Defender is Google YouTube Compliant
Google has been auditing our website and our tools to ensure we are using their Google YouTube API responsibly and have rewarded us with the Seal of Approval that means we can use their API with confidence.
We will continue to be audited and work with Google and together we will offer to our customers the fastest and most reliable service we can.
Dragon Defender History
DragonDefender.com was built from seeing a video from Charles Hoskinson back in 2020 stating how much spam and imposters comments he was receiving on his YouTube channel.
Now nearly a year on we have been building and testing the alpha then beta version and now monitor a selected number of Cardano based YouTube channels every 30 seconds and have deleted over 500,000 spam messages.
The biggest YouTube channel we look after has over 550k subscribers and has Cardano videos 3 or 4 times a week, we also look after other Cardano based channels that are growing at a fast pace such as:
"Kaizen Crypto" (22k subscribers) https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyf3zGnYK9jcF_mlRc_ztEA
"Cardano With Paul" (53k subscribers) https://www.youtube.com/c/CardanoWithPaul
Project Catalyst History
I am proud to have been selected as part of the Founder 50 members in Fund 1 and my team and I have delivered the Fund 3 project https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Visual-Studio-Smart-Contract-Plugin/333827-48088 and are currently working on the Fund 4 project https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Visual-Studio-Code-Market-Plugin/341436-48088
Roadmap
Please see our website for the latest roadmap
https://www.dragondefender.com/roadmap.php
Costs
Costs will follow.
We have self-funded this project for almost a year and although we will continue to fund dragondefender.com to have real impact the infrastructure needs investment. We can only scale about 30 YouTubers with the current model.
The current design allows for an unlimited amount of nodes so scalability has been built in however we need to incentivize people to run a node. We therefore want to build a Host-To-Earn model where we can reward node hosts to help the system grow.
Another major milestone is to move away from the central cloud hosting to be completely decentralized. We know how to do this but need funds to build and test.
It is natural to offer multiple services to our customers and we have started to build and would like to continue building a similar tool for Twitter.
What is success?
Success will be for the system to be able to expand and help 100's of YouTube channels and other social media platforms to fight the Spammers and Imposters.
The ultimate goal is to keep the service free to all Cardano Community members that promote the blockchain on the many different social media platforms.
IP
Unfortunately the IP cannot be shared, if the spammer and imposters knew our secrets the service would not work. We are keen to make some elements open source and work with others to help build the tools, and we are exploring ways this can be achieved.
What will the funds be used for?
Some of the funds will be used to scale the project and pay for additional hardware resources and the remaining will go towards adding an additional member to our team that will help to develop the software further. The funds will only last 3 months at which point we will continue to fund the "Free to Cardano Influencers" project ourselves, but the funding will be vital in allowing the project to get off the ground successfully.

project_solution:
Describe your solution to the problem


Build network of experts around the world to identify and respond to emerging regulatory threats to cryptocurrencies
details:
Detailed plan (not required) - Fill in here any additional details


There are a wide variety of existing and potential regulatory threats to the future development of cryptocurrencies and blockchain projects more generally. These include, among others:

taxation
securities regulation
anti-money laundering (AML) requirements
transaction and customer reporting (which relate to AML) -- e.g. recent cryptocurrency customer reporting proposal in US infrastructure legislation (see https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/02/how-language-in-the-infrastructure-bill-could-roil-the-crypto-markets.html))
direct regulation of crypto-related activities -- e.g. China restrictions on mining
law enforcement requirements -- e.g. retention of data for law enforcement investigations (similar requirements have long applied to communications companies).

For example, at the Project Catalyst town hall on 11 August, Charles Hoskinson described the major risk to cryptocurrency business models from the proposed US reporting legislation linked above, and the major engagement by the cryptocurrency community to convince US Congress to modify the legislation. 
Over time, regulation of cryptocurrencies will increase, as has happened over the last 20 years for Internet technologies generally. Rules will differ between countries, creating complexity for global operations. And eventually regulation will likely spread from cryptocurrencies to blockchain more generally.
It would be valuable for the Cardano community to build a worldwide network of experts who could identify such regulatory threats at an early stage and consider possible responses to them. The goal of this proposal is to start this effort by identifying appropriate experts in major jurisdictions and building a structure for them to cooperate (e.g. within the framework of Catalyst). Such a structure should ideally be community-driven, and limit reliance on expensive lawyers and consultants who tend to be the most visible experts on such regulation.
Outreach to potential participants in this effort would use a combination of existing Project Catalyst communications channels (e.g. Telegram, Discord, after Town Hall, etc) to involve the Cardano/Catalyst community, with outreach to a global network via email and other means. 
Deliverables and Definition of Success
Deliverables would be: 

Identification of members of the Cardano community in key jurisdictions around the world (e.g. US, EU, China, Japan, Switzerland, etc) who could act as sensors and report on regulatory developments
Proposed structure for future organization of this effort, including how issues would be passed on to IOHK/IOG, Cardano Foundation and others
Proposed approach to incentivizing participation in #2, using ADA or otherwise.

Success in this project could be defined as:

3 months: completed initial outreach to Cardano community to identify candidates for deliverable #1, and substantial progress in interviewing candidates; initial drafts of proposals for deliverables #2 and #3
6 months: completed deliverables
12 months: operational regulatory sensing network based upon the output of this proposal (would require further budget to move from completed deliverables above to an operational network).

Experience
I have 30 years of background in technology regulation and policy (as a lawyer, investor and director), and good contacts on technology regulation around the world. Further information on my background is at https://www.linkedin.com/in/mauryshenk/. Because I have many other commitments, a key goal of this project would be to find a broader team that can take it forward operationally. I have started discussions with Project Catalyst community members regarding such cooperation during the process of refinement of this proposal.
Budget
The proposed budget of USD 9000 (USD 1500 / month) is intended to be modest compensation for the time required on this effort over the first six months. My aim is to recruit one or more Catalyst community members to share the effort of the project, and to share the compensation.
