Collateralized debt platforms do not rely on lenders to provide liquidity as they can mint the stable-
coins themselves. With no refinancing costs, such systems can generate liquidity for free. Yet, most
platforms charge recurring fees for borrowing (as high as 20.5% ) which accumulate over time.
The variable fees (stability fees) are meant to regulate coin supply in order to maintain the peg of
the issued stable coin and correspond to an interest rate in traditional banking. Affecting new and
existing loans alike, interest rates only have an indirect impact on monetary supply and are rather
ineffective in the short term. While existing borrowers may not have the means to repay their loans
as an immediate reaction to rising interest, short-term speculators and leverage seekers might not be
greatly affected by interest rates in the first place.
 
Our solution:
XETB Protocol provides liquidity without charging borrowers interest or recurring fees. ETH holders
can obtain liquidity against their collateral for free. However, as an algorithmically controlled monetary instrument, the protocol charges a Borrowing Fee (as a one-time fee) for newly drawn liquidity
to support the peg with the ETB.
Users are free to utilize their stable coin, SETB, to participate in the broader Defi market consisting of many different products which are designed to generate yield.

Cardano is listing numerous dapps and there is little to no information as to the vetting process. The ICO market is rife with fraud and something needs to be done about it.  As an example: Plutuswap created a nice website regarding an upcoming dex on the Cardano blockchain and offered "their token" after exchanging ADA.  Plutuswap no longer exists and the scammers have gotten away with a lot of money of the adherents to Cardano.
 
What I propose is:
Any ICO that is to be on the Cardano blockchain must use a "smart contract", that will only release funds received by the ICO when certain milestones are met. 
It is to easy for a bad actor to create a fake dapp and sell coins.  Having an escrow like smart contract that only releases the funds as milestones are met will help eliminate the scammers and increase the trust in the Cardanosphere.

Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


Currently scammers are targeting ADA holders across Social Media platforms, phishing documents, websites, fake mobile apps, fake dApps and rug-pulls.
I envision using the immutable nature of the blockchain to empower the community to flag a scammers wallet address and monitor the movement of stolen Cryptocurrency on Cardano. 
This would be done by having dApps, Dex' and wallets having a "report scam" button built in, which would "black list" the scam wallet. In addition to community self-reports, tools such as the Cardano Phishing Bot (Twitter: @CardanoPhishing) could be utilised to identify scams in real-time, scrape the scam wallet address from the scammer's website and generate a contract preventing funds being sent to the scam wallet address. The victim would make a failed transaction and receive a notification alerting them of the scam and links to educate the victim on scams.
To prevent malicious reporting of wallet addresses, the person reporting would have to provide a URL from the originating scam and the exact amount of ADA stolen, the URL could be analysed for scam content.
Exchanges and DEX would be invited to work with the project to prevent converting to other crypto or fiat. If the report came in late and scammer was successful in converting to fiat, the scam report, blockchain data, wallet address and KYC from the exchange could be sent to law enforcement to investigate.

Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


Currently transaction fees on Cardano are fixed to the price of ADA, so if ADA goes up or down, relative to the dollar, so do transaction fees. This has meant that in the space of 1 year, fees have gone from less than a cent per transaction, to over 40 cents. 
I understand that this is no where near the huge fees we've seen on Ethereum, but it is enough to start to put some people off using Cardano and to look elsewhere. Also, if ADA continues to rise in price, the fees will only get higher too. So a $10 ADA would mean $1.70 transaction fees. 
I feel that this issue could be quite a big barrier to the growth of the network if not addressed soon, and I've not aware of any current plans to do so.
I therefore propose a change to the transaction fee formula/structure, that would result in long term stable price (in terms of dollar value) and low price.
I understand that there are other factors that are connected to transaction fees, like staking rewards, and that the fees cannot be 0, but if fees were less than a cent per transaction a year ago, why can't they be set at that value long term?
I am not a programmer or developer, so there may be technical or logistical reasons why this is impossible, but if networks like Solana can have transactions fees below a cent, even when their market cap is in the top 10, then why can't Cardano.
I think that a Cardano with guaranteed low and stable transaction fees would be hugely beneficial to its growth and prosperity and that if left unaddressed could pose a big problem in the months and years to come, leading to migration of users to other blockchains.

Predicting catastrophic failure is integral to safe design.  Construction design should consider contribution of heat transfer chemicals (HVAC, lubrication, fire etc) used in a structures' life-cycle operations.  Construction stakeholders (lead designers) are not transparently standing up for their decisions which prioritize profit over planetary health.  Decisions are not totemed for affect on planetary health.  Sometimes engineer sign-off occurs digitally without knowledge of the engineer.  Decisions can be tracked for predicted likelihood of catastrophe, temporal catastrophe tolerance level, stakeholder name, etc.  If it can be measured we can better manage it.  Blockchain can facilitate memorializing stakeholder decisions in construction.  This also could identify which countries are more risk tolerant (China, UK, etc.).  We may access thousands of data points on futball and cricket players, because much money is at stake in gambling.  Construction decisions gamble with health and profitability of entire planet.

The current academic system is closed, expensive and unfair.  The answer to the closed nature of academic publishing is often considered to be open access models where researchers/institutions pay prohibitively expensive Article Processing Charges (APCs)  to have their scientific materials reviewed, edited and published. Editors and peer reviewers are rarely paid and the process can take up to several years for articles. 
I propose here a Cardano-based publishing system which is focussed on openness and transparency and which is fast and responsive; fairly priced and which rewards and incentivizes high quality editors and peer reviewers through smart contracts set in reference to APCs.  Concurrently, this system would encourage research participant engagement with studies through Cardano-based incentives and would facilitate near real time sharing of data through decentralised clinical trials. The overall aim would be to be living, real-time, high quality research gathering and publication.

remarks:
Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


There isn't a widely socialized or accepted methodology for conflict resolution practiced within the Catalyst community currently.
 
For instance there are several ways these things are handled in other organizations. See below.
Simple 3-Step Conflict Resolution Scheme
To maintain a healthy community we need to settle differences, or solve disagreements, and there are simple ways we can do that. We can employ some basic principles that can help us to solve problems and keep good relationships with others.
Here is a simple three-step process: 

first, endeavor to settle the matter privately between those involved; 
second, if the initial step fails, bringing along a witness or two; 
and third, if the preceding step fails, taking the matter to the community as represented by the community leaders or advisors.

When we have an issue, conflict, dispute, or disagreement, it is a practical principle to approach the opposing individual, entity or institution with your position or concern. It's a best practice to allow them to hear from you directly about the reasons for your concern. Many times, it can be resolved by simply communicating and increasing each other's understanding. 
 If they do not acknowledge the issue nor offer to participate in resolving it, the second step can be taken. This involves including just one or two others who are aware of your concern, who can perhaps support your claim and influence a resolution. Your goal should be a peaceful conflict resolution in the spirit of community. 
 If this doesn't resolve the issue, your next option should be to involve those who are responsible for maintaining a healthy community. Once it is brought to the community leaders, it should be left with them.
If you aren't satisfied with how the community leaders address the concern, you are free to express your independence and leave the community. This is not new, as rage quitting is a common phenomenon in similar communities.  Below are some quotes from communities with programmatic rage quitting solutions.
Rage Quitting
"Rage quitting gives them the ability to express their discontent publicly and excommunicate themselves from the DAO."
https://github.com/pie-dao/docs/blob/master/pie-dao/rage-quitting.md
""Quitting" is a right.
In DAO speak, "rage quit" … is probably more aptly called "freedom to leave" or something like that."
https://daohaus.substack.com/p/rage-quit-exit-rights-and-real-skin
"Ragequit is the magic sauce
The ragequit mechanism of Moloch lowers the coordination cost even more. It ensures that if you, a member, really don't like a proposal you can exit with your funds before the proposal goes through."
*https://medium.com/odyssy/moloch-primer-for-humans-*9e6a4f258f78
 
DEFINITIONS AND RESEARCH
Conflict Resolution Law and Legal Definition
Conflict resolution means a process of resolving dispute or disagreement. It mainly aims at reconciling opposing arguments in a manner that promotes and protects the human rights of all parties concerned.
Generally, conflict resolution adopts the following five methods:
(1) problem solving or confrontation in which the two parties work together to find out a common solution;
(2) compromising in which both sides arrive on an agreement about their gain and loss;
(3) forcing in which the person having power direct a solution for acceptance by the other;
(4) smoothing in which the major points of agreement are given attention and disagreement between the two sides are not highlighted; and
(5) withdrawing in which either one or both sides withdraws from conflict.
The term conflict resolution is also known as dispute resolution or alternative dispute resolution. Other methods adopted for conflict resolution include negotiation, mediation, and diplomacy. Sometimes arbitration, litigation, and formal complaint processes such as ombudsman processes are also referred as conflict resolution.
https://definitions.uslegal.com/c/conflict-resolution/
 
"Dispute resolution or dispute settlement is the process of resolving disputes between parties. The term dispute resolution is sometimes used interchangeably with conflict resolution, although conflicts are generally more deep-rooted and lengthy than disputes. Dispute resolution techniques assist the resolution of antagonisms between parties that can include citizens, corporations, and governments."
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dispute_resolution
 
Other communities address dispute or conflict resolution using similar methods as above.

ADA has massive potentials to solve Africa's numerous currencies issues.  Its becoming very difficult for inter country trading.  The newly African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) initiative has brought much hope to entrepreneurs of the continent but two major issues stands as a bottle neck.
1. Numerous Currencies
2. Inter bank exchange rates, delays and regulations
So in a bid to start addressing these issues a simple approach for mass adoption campaign for Africans to start using  ADA cryptocurrency is needed.
My company Glonextech  ( Global Next Technology ) registered in South Africa, operating in Cape Town have been working with a team of cryptosystem enthusiasts, economists and legal experts to define ways to develop a fully functional set of free ecommerce plugins  that will equip shopping carts, POSs across the African Continent to incorporate the use of ADA as native or secondary currency for buying goods and services.  
Every ecommerce platform will install the plugin to start trading or accepting ADA.  Goods can be displayed in local Fiat currencies, upon checkout the buyer or shopper may choose to pay with ADA and earn points.  The plugin will be linked to a smart contract that generate ADA wallets for every app user.
The plugin will be developed and deployed freely across multiple ecommerce marketplace such as magento, wordpress, shoplify etc.
The second layer is to develop ADA Faucet App and plastic Cards linked to the smart contract.  These cards will be printed in large quantities and freely distributed to the public. The cards will be link to the app running a smart contract on the users phone. Any predefined use case will generate points.  Points or tokens can be converted to ADA by means of swapping, tokens can be used on ecommerce platforms running our plugins, fuel stations or garage, restaurant or shops that subscribed to attract cards holders as customers. 
As  partners on the network all purchases will reduce  credits form a pool. That means anytime a user buys from any partners shop using ADA, the wallet app generate free tokens that are redeemable by swapping to earn more ADA. Some may be converted to get discount on fuel and call credit on the app.
Therefore users will be required to download the management app that will create an ADA wallet, issue public addresses. Network partners will have a separate interface either through a plugin back end of their ecommerce store or POS and link to any swapping machine. Partners will also have a separate app to centrally manage their accounts.
Anytime a user buys ADA or transact using ADA, simply they can copy and paste the transaction code to earn fuel or call credits.
Users can use the card at any partner petrol station or. Uy Call credits from the app directly. As user become comfortable in shopping with ADA they can swap tokens in-app for ADA. 
Partner network menbers or vendors will credit a pool with the partner app or plugin with ADA to get buying traffic or  customers. That's the same ADA the smart contract will distribute as points to users. Anytime a partner credits the pool, his business or services will display on that locality closest to ADA shoppers or card holders. Shoppers or card holders can search partners in the app directory. Anytime shoppers swaps their card partners profile, credits automatically reduces until it depletes.
Majority of working class youths in many African countries ride on bikes and or have phones that need data as they carry on with business everyday. The fuel and calling credit the app will offer will encourage many to sign up creating ADA wallets everywhere which will intern attract more partners/vendors to sign up and credit the pool.
To motivates youths to massively adopt ADA, A life style of carrying an ADA faucets card with an app that converts point for ADA will drive massive adoption and excitement.  The cards can be swapped at shops, restaurants, garages, fuelling station etc.  
Many inter African trades will also be possible, ecommerce platforms with our plugin can attract buyers or card holders across the continent. Accepting ADA as payment takes away the stress of currency conversion and slow movement of cash, high transation fees etc. 
Glonextech don't need to reinvent the wheel but use simple common techniques to attract Africa's young population to up skill their passion for innovation. Cardano  ADA at the minds and pockets of everyone in Africa.

Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


Currently the state of stock exchanges is centralized which can result in major issues. Centralization leads to "having a single point of failure, a possible performance bottleneck or susceptibility to attacks and [is] time consuming. Furthermore, the central authority charges a fees and there is a lack of transparency of the auctioning process for the trader" (Bhandarkar). When I think of how current stock exchanges need revisions I think of Robinhood.
 
The envisioned state would be digitized tokens of shares of stock (or equity tokens) which could be easily traded between buyers and sellers. "By decentralizing the system, there is no central authority or intermediate needed for placing and executing the orders. This allows peer-to-peer transfer of stocks and direct buy and sell of equities between the traders without a need of third party to intermediate the trade. This reduces the transaction cost occurred on each trade, time needed for transaction would be significantly reduced and provides enhanced security as well as transparency" (Bhandarkar). Transactions and trades would be near instant, get rid of the middleman, lower fees, and increase security. I only see benefits to creating a system like this and think Cardano is the perfect blockchain to create a technology like this on. With smart contracts this will definetely be possible on the blockchain and could massively alter and improve the entire way people trade stocks. This method is complete peer-to-peer trading. This wouldn't be replacing today's systems, simply another option people can use.

Currently NFTs are sold on the secondary market with nothing more than the trust that it is authentic and not forged.  Sure you can do some research and find if the piece is authentic or a copy, but many users either don't know how to go about doing this or aren't aware they can be scammed.  With this project we create a COA on the blockchain that is for any particular NFT or actual physical item.  Through the chain of ownership an item can be verified all the way back to the original owner or creator to insure authenticity.  The COA would include all identifiers needed to describe the piece, every change of ownership and the price at time of sale, and can also have a current appraisal price along with the name of the appraisor attached anytime the piece is appraised.  This COA system can also be applied to physical items such as sports memorabilia, collectibles, antiques, movie props, etc., the list is endless.

As it stands now, these are some reasons why blockchain technology is needed for elections in Nigeria:
1. Some politicians/political parties arm the youths with guns and weapons to unleash mayhem on members of opposing parties to intimidate people to vote for their own party and in cases where these armed youths realise that they are not going to win at a particular voting centre/location, they shoot in the air to disperse the crowd then destroy election materials or take them away.
2. The need for people to leave their homes to travel far to vote will be overcomed. 
3. Vote buying (this is when politicians induce votes to vote for them on election day with gift items/food or sometimes cash) will be a thing of the past as each voters will be at home without the need for them to gather at a place for inducement.
4. The use of under aged children can also be eliminated. 
5. The cost of conducting elections will be brought down drastically to the bearest minimum. 
6. Most importantly, the manipulation and tampering of election results will automatically become history since there would not be any opportunity to tamper the blockchain. 
7. And finally, the results will be obtained in real time.
So utilising blockchain solves a lot of problems associated with election malpractices in Nigeria. The major issue that might arise in carrying out this project would be lettimg everyone within the voting age to have a digital identity that will be used during voting.

In it's current state, I see no available tools to integrate Cardano with Unity3D. Game development will be of particular interest with NFTs and smart contracts around the corner. One possible integration method that I think would be a quick win for the ecosystem, is to integrate Yoroi and Unity Web games using a plugin. 
I personally have worked on something similar to bridge Unity Web Games with Metamask for Ethereum.  As Yoroi updates come out, they expect to be similar to MetaMask for Ethereum. Since this is the case, there may be an easy gap that my team can fill. By filling this gap, we will not only bring more developers to Cardano, but will also encourage more developments to integrate further beyond just Unity Web Games.
The expected outcome of this proposal would be a Unity Plugin that integrates with Yoroi through a javascript api. This plugin would allow users to do the following when playing a game:
1. sign into their Cardano wallet
2. check their ADA balance as well as other Native Token Balances.
3. check their addresses for any matching NFTs for the game they are playing.
4. once the NFT is verified, the player would unlock whatever the developers tied the NFT ownership to. This could be playable characters, upgrades, or any other digital asset.
While this solution isn't something that will integrate mobile apps built in Unity, I think it's a great start. This will also attract other developers to help build the tools we need for gaming in the future.
 
Funding would be used to assess the feasibility of the solution using the current tools described above. An initial search, shows that Emurgo has a dApp connector for Yoroi that would be used for this case but the dApp conector is in a current nightly version(Yoroi = 4.5.7002 and dapp-connector = 0.4.0).  In addition it seems like a project in fund 5 is proposing to build a connector and they did work on this emurgo connector. This would be perfect timing to use this upcoming connector for a Unity Plugin.
Continued Funding would be used to build the Unity plugin using the dApp connector and make it public to Unity Game Developers. Advanced funding could be used to add features requested by new Cardano Game developers or create more plugins for Mobile Development. It would be nice to build something for Unreal Engine as well since those are the two most popular Game Engines right now.
Expected costs depends on the state of the dApp connector and the exact functionality provided or If the feasibility assessment reveals there are other tools that can be used in place of the dApp connector.

scaffold.eth (github repository for a plethora of boilerplate framework for fast implementation of prototypes)
BrightID/Proof of Humanity (sybil resistance/ p2p dID implementation , i.e. cross-party barcode scans with strict limits on authenticity per registration mechanism)
Polymarket (betting market with a twitter account managed by a drunk/otherwise impaired intern)
Olympus DAO (reserve currency that is NOT pegged to any fiat currency, but still maintains price above a threshold)
MetaCartel (like Catalyst, a DAO that invests in application layer)
OpenSea/Rarible/Superrare/etc. (NFT marketplaces)
other DAOs with collective ownership over traditional commercial niches like content creation, land management, intellectual property, gated communities, etc.
I could go on and on.

There is a gap, I humbly think, between the mental model of any every-day person and interactions with blockchain technology. Specifically, visualizations of smart contract interactions that are easy to understand, interact with, comprehend, easily understand how it applies to a person's life, and visualizes over time what has happened. Experimenting and building interactions that allow users to interact with the smart contract is comprehensive and individual ways helps in adopting the technology.
Visualizations and interfaces in the blockchain area are evolving rapidly. And Dapps, but I also see a gap that could complement the rapid iteration of building particular applications to wide-scale adoption, and that is in how we visualize smart contracts. Working on how the end-user will have an elegant,, but highly usable interface to smart contracts. There is modeling language for visualization for blockchain, but none in the area of Dapps or specifically for the novice, Currently visualizations for blockchain  is applied for development and while that's cool, it is difficult to find interactions that pertain to the mental model of the end user. 
For example, Felix Härer and Hans-Georg Fill write about it  in their research "A COMPARISON OF APPROACHES FOR VISUALIZING BLOCKCHAINS AND SMART CONTRACTS" that though we currently have different ways to model blockchain transactions, ledgers, and domain specific modeling languages, they argue that when it comes to smart contract : "...visual models are presented on the same level of abstraction as technical models." I agree. They go on to say that in order to allow an understanding by the end user for smart contract technology, "Visualization by itself is, thus, insufficient. While the reviewed design approaches might be appropriate for technical development processes, and while the analysis approaches might provide insight when conducting targeted investigations, their broader applicability in domains outside of technical fields is limited."
Given this gap, I think it will be a large impediment to wide-scale adoption. But, ever optimistic, I would like very much to propose that smart contracts CAN BE visualized in a manner that is eloquent, easy-to-underand, and powerful. 
The gap I currently have is at a project level and needing support to accomplish this (if it is useful). The first use case is a Garden | Climate Journal application. Wireframes and specifications are complete, and I can organize user testing but do not know how to go about development and need resources and help. Also, the first project is very much focused on visualizing smart contracts to the mental model of an every-day person for the purpose of helping people interact with nature, trade, sell, barter food in any way they want and easily show this in a smart contract. Testing often with every-day people, whether or not this is working well as a smart contract visualization, modifying, and iterating, etc. in an Agile manner is something I would highly embrace with a development team. The wireframes and specifications are complete, product planning and user testing are not an issue: I am very much struggling with finding developers and funding to make this project happen.

Hi Cardano Developers,
I am interested in bridging todays centralized currencies to the blockchain. Every micro transaction game from fortinite to clash royal has an onboarding ramp from fiat into their centralized proprietary in game currency. I want to build the tools so that these micro transaction game companies will actually adopt so they list game currencies on the blockchain creating an on ramp from their centralized proprietary in game currency to the blockchain and back. From a user experience angle one needs to be able to tell the micro transaction company they want their in game currency transferred to them on the blockchain as soon as possible. 
 
There are existing ways of doing this. You can bundle a bunch of transactions from the day, take them to a cold server over night, sign the transactions, then send them out in the morning. This procedure, though pretty secure, is very cumbersum and negatively effects the customer experience.
 
The transition from centralized proprietary currency to crypto currency needs to be seamless. Give micro transaction game public key, you get crypto in the next 5 minutes, or less. It is one thing to get insurance or something if your hot server holding the minting/token key gets compromised leading to stolen tokens, it is something else entirely giving organizations ability to invalidate transactions within a certain amount of time after minting using a cold key . Executive teams at these micro transaction game companies are not going to get behind a blockchain bridge if the hot server can be compromised leading to damages, too much risk. The ability to detect incorrect minting and nullify transactions within a specified time frame, say 72 hours, using a cold private key is something these executive teams could get on board with.
Now for the technical side of thing...
If one were to mint a centralized currency via a bridge to Cardano could one invalidate transactions and have them tracked via UTxO. Let's say a micro transaction game wants to list their currency on a Dex. They have some API running on their backend that when it receives a request it mints the tokens on the blockchain. Let's say that the hot server minting the tokens gets compromised and then a bunch of tokens are minted by the attacker and sent to hundreds of different addresses. Would it be possible to have a offline wallet sign a transaction that would invalidate any transactions signed by the hot wallet after a specific block and then sign a new hot wallet? What I just described is just a centralized proprietary cryptocurrency with extra steps the key value proposition would be that the ability to nullify transactions only exists for a specific (period of time/number of blocks) after minting. We could even have it so the cold wallet can sign away its ability to mint or reduce the amount of time transactions are allowed to be invalidated. 
Is this part of Extended UTxO or would it have to be a smart contract?

Coastal communities practicing artisanal fishing (or traditional / subsistence fishing) in the UNESCO World Heritage site of Sanganeb Marine National Park and Dungonab Bay – Mukkawar Island Marine National Park in the Red Sea coast of Sudan have limited abilities and/or alternatives to address overfishing and the gradual depletion of fish stocks in their fishing areas.
Poverty and lack of structured management practices of fishing areas that are accessible to coastal fishermen (shallows and reef fishing) has locked the fishing communities of the two villages falling in the marine national park in a vicious downward spiral of declining fish stocks and increased poverty.
The proposed solution will create/develop an incentive mechanism (based on blockchain and Cardano) for fishermen in the two villages of the Marine Protected Area to develop and adopt zoning plans for their fishing grounds that ensure species being fished (and under duress) are given the time to replenish and increase in stock whilst at the same time contribute to improving the livelihoods of the fishermen.
When the solution is developed and proven to work, it will serve as a model which can be upscaled and replicated to serve other coastal communities in the developing world who are struggling with this same problem.

We are all aware of the flaws that plague the healthcare industry. We have made little to no stride in this space. Those with no coverage pay out of pocket or simply go untreated. Another failed system accepted by society across the globe. 
Open-source Medicine:  Cost of medications stabilizes and becomes available to all. No co-pay, prior authorization, just medicine simplified.  This is not just from a pharmaceutical perspective. In-patient, out patient, and diagnostic services included. 
What does one do when the wheel is not the most practical way of moving ? Add more wheels?  
This would distribute wealth to across the block-chain. In essence for those who would elect to give up an antiquated legacy system and usher in change would be rewarded by a privacy first, patient first, policy. One they can trust because all but their data would be open and available on the block chain. 
Current systems such as HL7 can be integrated then dismantled. If you want to travel over-sees your data and history is with you always. Controlled by any number of functions i.e. time lock read-only, edit or share functions all controlled by the owner. 
Currently diagnostic imaging uses a Modality to make a .dcm image loaded with patient data (CT scan can be over 1000 images all of which hold private data) -> next it gets sent to a router, relay, load balancer, and finally if nothing fails it lands at a netgate to be compressed into a digestible format so that a reading radiologist who, may or may not be in the same location can sit up look at the .dcm and dictate opinion. These images are stored locally to be recalled at any time for any use with or without the permission of the patient. At any point in the process these images can be copied, stored and taken away without repercussion.
Could we not mint 1-of-1 NTF's and use wallets as custody to maintain a level of privacy and control unlike ever before? 
Language should not be a barrier. Location should enhance. Every person with a breath a voice.

There is a significant delay in the time between when Community Advisors and Veteran Community Advisors make their contributions and when incentive reward payments are distributed. In the case for CA's in reviewing fund 5, this is up to two months from when reviews opened.
The information required to evaluate whether the contributions are valid is available from the end of the VCA period. This is an example where a smart contract, once fed the requisite information on valid contributions could conduct the random allocation and send payments.
Is there a good reason for the decision to delay these further? Perhaps the initial decision on linking the timeline of rewards payments to project payments was made in earlier rounds when the review and voting process was more compressed?
Cardano obviously understands the time value of money hence all the effort that has gone into providing the infrastructure for staking.
If these were paid at the VCA completion date, the rewards would also be able to be used for voting.
As the rewards are denominated in USD, but paid in ADA, it also increases exposure to exchange rate volatility in both ADA/USD and their native currency/USD for the intervening 1 month period.
This is not an expectation of change in the current round, just a suggestion on design on timing going forward.

The current state of Project Catalyst, is confusing. As Amazing and important as Project Catalyst is, it's not well known. For my solution I propose:
We form Action groups with special skillsets. Each necessary Skill set will be discussed agreed upon once the groups are formed. These groups will contain members each meeting a specific skill set necessary to evaluate the current proposal. Groups for each proposal will be picked at random to evaluate portions of proposals. Once Evaluated by each group member is performed, they vote and then the proposal goes on public display with all the proposers research in hand. At his point it's open for further public improvements or votes. Once it has gone through the process of evaluations, I will make a YouTube video showing and explaining the project and what teams evaluated it. The evaluations will bring attention to the space. We will invite others to vote on the proposal as well. Proposals that are awarded funding through this evaluation process, are rewarded by the treasury, as well as the CA's who evaluated it. This will help create a positive feedback loop for the evaluators efforts.
Each project contains a "Success Bounty": This consist of three phases of success. Each phase has a rewards value if reached successfully.
Phase one: successful vote accumulations resulting in funding. (1st smallest predetermined reward to CA's involved in the evaluation and dissemination of project information.)
Phase two completion of the project upon the schedule it was estimated or projected (ranges of acceptability will be discussed). (2nd reward on scale of delivery of successful project on time, close, better late than never) On time pays most and scales down to a minimal amount, not zero, effort should be rewarded.
Phase three a pre-decided success value this project offers to the network. did the project in some way increase the x+y=z, this will be discussed per project during evaluation, this will be the highest reward as this result is our Alpha result, a successful project working on the network. This will complete the success bounty cycle.
As projects vary greatly each evaluation will include the "Success Value" this value through the process of its evaluation. Each phase will increase in rewards, this will promote tracking and updates on projects. The Potential is great for this arena, we must create a symbiotic relationship between proposers, evaluators and the outcome (funded or not). This means proposers are motived to get funds by the work and future prospects of their proposal. Evaluators CA's, will be motivated to evaluate projects worth funding and get rewarded for that effort and following success of that funding.
Proposals that do exceptionally well offer a bonus to evaluators (CA's) and a reputation NFT. I can make some CA's evaluator NFT tokens. CA's can compete for these and when enough are collected can be turned in for funding private projects or tuned in for (items to be discussed later). These NFT's will be rewards for quality work yielding projects that enhanced our system. The criteria for that will be determined by the groups who evaluate the proposal, as each proposal will have different attributes that may not translate across multiple uses cases. This will be a dynamic process that over time will grow and enforce an evaluation protocol for projects that yield higher probability for success.

A Cardano-wallet-seed it should always restore the same wallet, no matter if you use Daedalus, Ledger, Trezor, AdaLite or Yoroi. Therefore the derivation path for key generation has to be standardized.
Right now this is NOT the case. You just get a different empty wallet. The end user is scared and will loose trust in the Cardano system. This is a serious incompatiblity issue and needs to be solved.
SOLUTION suggestion: 
- New Cardano-wallet: key generation should done that the seed is compatible with any Cardano-software/hardware wallet and is always pointing to the same wallet. This requires a joint venture with all wallet developers. So far, I believe that only Ledger and Trezor need to do any changes, everything else seems to be in sync, but it needs to be verified.
- if the user restores a Cardano-wallet, the key generation should be done by default as above, but the user must have an option like "restore from older wallet version" and the wallet is restored the old way. Or the system automatically searches for a non-empty Cardano-wallet.
The competitors have this compatibility: It works perfect with every hardware or software Ethereum-wallet.

The Ministry of Health with a budget of $10 million dollars runs a fragmented health service delivery ; lacks institutional capacity for policy-making, regulation, coordination, planning, management and contracting; and does not have use of data in decision-making. Most if not all 15 million Somalis living in Somalia do not have any government issued electronic or paper health records or vital records such as a birth certificates and medical records. Less than 30% of the Somali population have access to health services. The neonatal mortality rate is 40 deaths per 1000 live births and the under-5 mortality rate is 137 deaths per 1000 live births. The maternal mortality rate is estimated at 732 per 100 000 live births. The use of family planning remains low, resulting in high fertility rates. Only 11% of children receive the basic vaccinations needed to protect them from common childhood illnesses such as measles and polio, for which the world has long had the technical solutions to defeat. Just a third of children are born with the services of a skilled midwife, nurse or doctor and one in twenty women aged fifteen today will die of pregnancy and birth related complications.
Private health services, NGOs, and the pharmaceutical sector are largely unregulated in Somalia. Health services are delivered through a poorly regulated and uncoordinated network of NGOs and the private sector, the health sector grapples with chronic shortfalls in capacity, infrastructure and medical personnel. Funding for the health sector comes from international donors and is 'off-budget'.
The creation of a health insurance company (Health Maintenance Organization or HMO) using contributions (small set aside) from remittances sent to Somalia will help rebuild the fragmented healthcare system. Annually $1.6 billion is sent by the Diaspora, if 1% or $16 million for example was pooled to create this HMO with facilities and personnel, the recipients of remittances will have access to health care in a country where the Ministry of Health has an annual budget less than $10 million for the entire country.
The UN and NGOs have for the last few years convened meetings and initiatives examining ways to move their engagement in Somalia from a humanitarian to development focus. Both the UN and various NGOs have for the over 30 years provided humanitarian aid to Somalia. As the country is becoming more stable these organizations are working with the government to find ways to address the sustainability of programs and services, they have funded post humanitarian aid by providing technical assistance to federal, state and local institutions.
The World Bank through its initiative - the Global Financing Facility for Women, Children and Adolescents (GFF) is spearheading efforts with the World Health Organization and Somalia's Ministry of Health to introduce Universal Health Coverage for Somalia's population. Through these discussions, the partnership has addressed the many issues facing Somalia's national health care system and the need for private sector intervention. [GFF, is a country-led global partnership committed to ensuring all women, children and adolescents can survive and thrive.]
There will be start up costs associated with this endeavor of course which would be worthwhile if UN and NGOs contributed by enrolling those they serve. Our high-level plans to engage the UN and NGOs for support include sharing our project as a tangible strategy to putting into action their aspiration of phasing out humanitarian aid for the country by showing them a side-by-side cost-benefit analysis at the micro and macro levels (i.e., overall current national health care situation and examples of enrolling their patients in our health insurance program versus what they are currently offered). In addition, our health insurance program will help meet the priority areas identified in both the Somali National Development Plan for 2019–2024 and the Somali Universal Health Coverage (UHC) Roadmap, launched in September 2019. Both plans identify primary health care as the main approach to improving health outcomes in the country. The government of Somalia, multilateral and bilateral partners have identified 5 priorities for enhanced collaboration to accelerate progress towards UHC which include: 1) Establishment of a health coordination mechanism, 2) Improving access to a package of high-quality essential health services, 3) Strengthening emergency preparedness and response through UHC, 4) Strengthening the role and capacity of the Ministry of Health, and 5) Harnessing the private sector for UHC. This endeavor will not only close the access gap but it will give patients enrolled a record (birth certificate, medical record, etc.) and also health care providers and facilities a way to be rated, accredited and credentialed.
Although funding from the Catalyst Project will not completely sustain the initiation, planning, execution, and evaluation of our project it will give us the credibility by serving as a launchpad. This funding will help support the initiation and planning phases of our project lifecycle.

About voteme 
Currently music fans buy concert tickets after a promoter has booked the artists, they have no say in which artist comes to perform or when.  Our platform is designed to give music fans the ability to create live concerts by voting for the artist that they want to see perform.  Voteme provides fans with a unique ability to chose
This voting is done by the purchase of a security token. We provide artists with unique security tokens that is valued based on the average price of their concert tickets. 1 token is equal to 1 concert ticket, For example if the average retail price of an artist's concert ticket is 65$ then the artist's token is valued at 65$
We also provide artists with a marketplace where they can sell their tokens at a wholesale price, giving fans and retail investors an opportunity to buy and sell with the aim of using or earning a profit. 
 
This opens the market as fans in any country in the world can book an artist instead of waiting for a promoter who is limited by geography. 
 
We are currently in talks with SONY music to create a partnership that allows us to build digital assets for artists
Just as holders of ADA token can decide to vote for this project as the best project for ADA, We want to also give music fans all over the world the ability to do the same with music artists.

Prior to Uber, the taxi industry was dominated by companies. Some large, some small, but in most places there existed choices. The truly savvy individual could run their own taxi and charge slightly less but keep all their profit. There were hybrid situations where people rented taxis and then ran their own business.  When Uber came along and desensitized people to the idea of riding in a strangers car, suddenly people could work for themselves when they wanted to. People who traditionally wouldn't be driving t taxi full time now could at their leisure work part-time for some much-needed income.  Initially, people thought it was a good thing that there were no more taxi companies and people could get a taxi when they wanted and often-times cheaper. Then Uber got greedy and began taking larger amounts from people with fees and less pay per mile.  Combined with some economic down-turns and suddenly people are working forty plus hours per week but still struggling.
The problem now is because everybody pretty much uses Uber or Lyft there is no more competition for prices and it's the hard-working drivers who are losing out.  You can't work for yourself because people rarely think to flag a taxi down when it's so convenient to use a ride-sharing app.  The average rider just wants to feel safe and get to their destination as quickly and as cheaply as possible. The average driver just wants to earn a fair wage and not get cheated when they are doing all the work.
There needs to be a way where competition is brought back to the market and people once again have a choice. Decentralized finance is taking over the world and its time we bring that same community management to ride-sharing. Getting in a stranger's personal car should be as should be a transaction between that person and the rider. I want to create an ecosystem where ride-share drivers can make money, save money, borrow money, and exchange money.

Examples of these health problems are allergies, asthma, the spread of respiratory infections, and cancer. Research shows that there are chemicals in building materials that make occupants sick.
 
According to the United States Environmental Protection Agency, "On average, we spend about 90 percent of our time indoors, where pollutant levels are often higher than those outside. Indoor pollution is estimated to cause thousands of cancer deaths and hundreds of thousands of respiratory health problems each year. In addition, hundreds of thousands of children have experienced elevated blood lead levels resulting from their exposure to indoor pollutants".
 
As stated by the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, "The average person spends 65 percent of their entire life inside their home. Your home is your health. It's that simple".
 
Multiply your age by .90, and that is how many years you have spent indoors. Then multiply your age by .65, and that is how my years you have spent in your home.
 
Per the National Center for Biotechnology Information, U.S. National Library of Medicine, "The built environment can promote healthy environments and behaviors, as well as mitigate adverse health outcomes. Air quality, social equity, community cohesion, physical safety, transportation choices, traffic-related crashes, water quality, access to healthy foods, physical activity levels, access to nature, and daylight levels all influence public health."
 
Here are some essential reputable links regarding this problem:
 
https://www.epa.gov/indoor-air-quality-iaq/healthy-buildings-healthy-people-vision-21st-century
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5784210/
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK44634/
https://sftool.gov/learn/about/576/buildings-health#building-design
https://www.cdc.gov/nceh/publications/factsheets/impactofthebuiltenvironmentonhealth.pdf
https://homes.forhealth.org/
https://healthybuilding.net/

There is low/no priority on wellness life in most real estate development and building.
Research shows that there are toxic chemicals in building materials of modern homes/buildings.
There are negative health impacts from the built environment.
There is a lack of focus on building healthy homes.
There are too many cookie cutter home communities (all the houses look the same).

I went through many ideas here in IdeaScale (IS) reporting on IS problems and shortcommings and I would like to sum it here and propose how it should work and ask if there is a plan to move in that direction. I am project manager, software architect and engineer so I gave it some thought.
 
Current state:
1. great social dynamics for sharing, discussing and improving ideas/proposals
2. privately owned source code with more clients than just Cardano. This makes it harder to fit the solution for Cardano needs (slow, expensive changes)
3. hard for newbies (currently solved by solutions build separatelly from IS)
4. no statistics, no data aggregation. This is currently solved by floating sheets and tools trying to build on top of IdeaScale (not very successfully)
5. no post-VOTING stage. With each fund more and more proposals are being implemented, but there is no history in IS and it is hard to track what was funded in previous rounds and more importantly to audit and report progress.
6. no mobile app, hard to navigate in mobile responsive version of the web app
7. no linking and grouping proposals
 
Envisioned state:
1. keep the social dynamics and build on it
2. open source code - more people could contribute
3. tooltip walkthrough the system explaining basic concepts and how to move forward in each step of the process for faster onboarding
4. Challenges repeat themselfs in funds and we should be able to track how much funds went into them through multiple funds. They should be separate entities living outside Campaigns and Proposals should be linked to these Challenges. The "Funds amount" field should be a property of a Proposal, so we could do this aggregations (how much ADA have we spent on challenge Developer ecosystem so far this year, etc)
5. There should be charts detailing ratio between requested and available funds in a current campaign (fund), funds distribution between challenges in a campaign and many more …
6. Proposals should be grouped in Projects in a way, that Project can have multiple proposals. Projects would be owned by a Team and one user could be part of different teams (working on multiple projects). Some proposals in a Project can be funded, some don't, some in progress, but we would see which Proposals belong toghether to one context and their state.
7. From funded Proposals we could create Projects living in the post-VOTING stage and this could serve as a point of reference for decision making on new proposals by the same team and to track the progress of the Project or proposal and audit it. Additionally, by "Funds amount" aggregation we would see how much ADA went into this and that Project or Team so we could see the value we gave and the value we received.
8. Proposals should be linkable between themselfs with a ceratain relationship (relates to/duplicates/… )
8. GraphQL API would be very usefull so other people could easily build on top of this system whatever thay want (by keeping privacy and security) and not be restricted by limiting API structure.
9. Reputation should play important role and it should come from the blockchain (connection to mainnet). Reputation should be visible and probably it should influence how are certain reviews/ratings/opinions weighted
10. Existing mobile app with same features as a web app
11. App localization should be led by the community
12. Advanced search in proposals (filtering not reviewed/not visited/seeks help/amount requested/….)

Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


Currently, short films are a necessity for filmmakers to prove their merit in the industry.  They are economical in their length as well as in their means of production.  They are the official calling card or "diploma" filmmakers need to show investors that they have the talent needed to undertake a larger industry project.  Martin Scorsese, Christopher Nolan, David Lynch, Walt Disney,  Maya Deren, and Denis Villeneuve all started their careers making short films.  However, while this rich and expressive cinematic medium is an essential part of any filmmakers' career, the thousands of short films made every year rarely, if ever, provide a true means of income for the artists making them.  
That may change however with the rise of the NFT.  The NFT has served as an incredible means of providing new and sustainable revenue streams for graphic design artists, but the NFT market has yet to truly tap the film industry.  Feature films in a sense may be too long and cumbersome to collect and showcase, however, the short film would provide endless possibilities for film curators and collectors to amass a unique and one of a kind collection of cinematic art.  These short film NFTs can even serve as a stock exchange of sorts for independent filmmakers looking to fund their next feature project or television series. 
As the program director for the Flickers' Rhode Island International Film Festival and an experimental filmmaker myself, I have worked with thousands of short filmmakers over the years from across the globe, and they seem to always say the same thing: "never expect to make any money on your short film."  Well, this might very well be possible now. 
An NFT market "Short Flicks" specifically geared towards short filmmakers has the potential to engage the global independent film industry and its supporters in ways that could potentially revolutionize the art of cinema as we know it today.  This could also serve as a means of empowerment for filmmakers living in many parts of the world where it is not possible to have easy access to standard sources of funding for cinematic projects.  Filmmakers in Africa, Iran, Venezuela, Cuba, and Nepal would finally have a means of accessing funding for their work, which would lead to more films being produced and more unique stories being told.  
Through empowering the global independent film industry as a whole, this project would not only help to build a more vibrant and dynamic ecosystem for filmmakers to receive funding and exhibit their work worldwide, but also help to further generate exponential exposure for the Cardano network.  Filmmakers are master social influencers by nature after all, and helping them could be just what is needed to further achieve large scale awareness of the benefits of blockchain technology.

Currently countries like my own (Sudan) rely primarily on donations and loans while the country owns natural and human resources capable of making it among the major suppliers of many major products. Lack of identity system, proper investment regulations and spread of corruption as well as the poor infrastructure makes it difficult for the human talents to achieve its full potential and break free from that vicious cycle of poverty. 
Similar to what Muhamad Yunus's Grameen bank has achieved in Bangladesh as well as many countries across the world, Blockchain Reaction (BCR Bank) can achieve these goals by providing an identity system for the underprivileged majority in Africa as a first step, after which provide microfinance for small projects.
Cardano Africa event presented the work done in primarily Ethiopia and Tanzania which is a smart decision from IO to target those 2 in particular because they have wise governments that are working hard for the future of their people, which is not yet the case for Sudan despite the recent revolution. Yet Sudan is an undiscovered gold mine,  it is endowed with considerable and widely diversified natural resources , most significant of which is agricultural and agro-pastural lands , rainfall ranging between 200-2000 mms ( north to south ), the River Nile and its tributaries carrying an annual average of 85 milliard cubic meters  , in addition to over 130 livestock units (cattle , sheep, goats and camels ). Sudan is also very rich of natural resources , including but not limited to , petroleum , iron ore , copper , chrome ore , zinc , mica , silver and gold.

The inflation rate in the country where I live (Nigeria) for example is about 12% - 15% a year, Nigeria which is one of Africa's largest economies suffers from a rapidly depleting currency, so are the other countries on the continent, even at a larger rate.
This dramatically affects each individual, and undercut their power in the global economy,
Making their life long savings, which they have worked very hard for, useless by the day.
Take West Africa for example, in Nigeria millions of people have to save a great percentage of their earnings monthly, to be able to carter for their future.
the most popular digital savings platform in Nigeria (PiggyVest) for example, records over 2 million savings monthly on its platform, with over 60% of the users being female (which is pretty great),
The downside is, they don't have the choice to choose what assets they would like to keep their savings in except in the local currency, and this slowly erodes the value of the money over time, to the point where it basically becomes worthless.

CONTRIBUTION TOKEN ENGAGEMENT MODEL
The main problem we seek to solve:
Open-source projects need a scalable way to recognize, reward & bolster reputation of committed contributors & incentivize quality decision-making.
The proposed solution we will implement:
Develop a contribution token. This is a staged approach to tokenomics that will start simply and progress to intermediate and eventually become a full complex governance token incentive method.
BACKGROUND
NFT-DAO is emerging from the Project Catalyst community as a collective of 300+ like-minded individuals looking to pool resources and develop an NFT framework on Cardano. Since forming, NFT-DAO has merged or collaborated with 18 Catalyst proposers from Funds 2-5. NFT-DAO is an emergent organisation that is constantly iterating and learning how to work with new and diverse individuals, and considering a range of different viewpoints and ideas. We have looked to Cardano and Project Catalyst as an inspiration for what a collaborative community is and can become. We are also aware of the challenges Project Catalyst faces as it grows in scale and reach, including the challenges of maintaining standards of quality in such a fast-growing environment. Our goal is not only to watch and learn from these challenges, but to align any solutions that may arise between our organisations, and that may apply to other current or prospective DAO's forming in the space.
In our commitment to develop a collaborative economy dedicated to NFT's, we registered NFT-DAO as a DAO-LLC under Wyoming law in March 2021.
This is a Proposal by:
NFT-DAO, a Project Catalyst Fund3 Recipient for a Comprehensive NFT Framework Collab to build a penultimate composable NFT Framework on Cardano. NFT-DAO is a community of 300+ members composed of Developer, UX/UI, Governance, Creative and Marketing holons (working groups). Our motto: 'We work better together'.
NFT-DAO Fund3 Proposal: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Comprehensive-NFT-Framework-Collab/334521-48088
We have also been very humbled by the vote of support by the Catalyst community in receiving a Fund3 budget allocation. Our holon-teams are busy working toward our major milestones, including delivering a composable marketplace for the community to build on.
CURRENT OPPORTUNITIES
Although we are not near the scale of Project Catalyst, NFT-DAO does have a community of 300+ members, each with varying degrees of engagement and activity within the DAO. Some of the early challenges we have found in building a collaborative community has been:

1--how we communicate and make decisions within a large community?
2--how we balance people's right to open discussion (to have a voice and be heard) with finding closure and initiating action?
3--how to onboard newcomers who may feel overwhelmed by a proliferation of information?
4--how to implement fair and equitable consensus mechanisms in relation to varying degrees of community input and investment?
5--how to navigate centralised leadership with distributed ideals?
6--how to manage dissent, disillusionment or conflicts of interest/ideals?
7--how to reward contributions for members who are volunteering their time?
It is apparent that some of the challenges we have experienced in establishing an emerging DAO align with Fund 5's Distributed Decision-Making challenge.
PROPOSED SOLUTION
As our goal from the start has been to transition toward a decentralised, self-governing and self-organising DAO – as patterned after Cardano – with members being rewarded in proportion to their contributions. Rewards can be distributed in the form of token utilities for contributions made or governance voting/decision-making. The NFT-DAO has been working on a multi-tiered tokenomics model that can be templated and applied within Project Catalyst, and other DAO's who see fit to use it. The principal tiers of the tokenomics model are:


1--A Project Roadmap;
2--Business Development Stages;
3--Business Milestones;
4--Token Sale Rounds;
5--Token Circulation, with percentage splits;
6--A Token Utility Development Cycle: a) Contribution Token, b) Governance Voting Token, c) Pro-bono Token, d) Kudos Token, e) Retail Investment Token;
7--Contribution Metrics captured per Token Development Cycle;
8--Decentralisation;
9--Metrics of member engagement levels;
10--Onboarding Incentives.
A staged approach to tokenomics (that progresses from simple, through intermediate to complex token templates) will enable delivery of tokens in the near, intermediate and long term. Our process for tracking tokens in the near-term will adapt existing solutions such as the Cardano Registry GitHub to capture contributions. Further research and development will be required to explore cross-DAO auditing options, as metric capture will also need to take quantitative and qualitative contributions into account.
Note: A quantitative contribution is objective, material, untrusted, trackable, accountable (something that can be automated in principle). A qualitative contribution is subjective, involves trust, differences, ranges, balances (something that requires human intervention or representation in the form of voting etc.). A quantitative contribution can always be extracted from data.
How do we encourage people to participate in decision making?
Within this tokenomics model, the high-level goal is to eventually develop a machine-assisted collaborative economy, with automation of voting and engagement mechanisms and tokenised rewards. As this is a more advanced stage of development, this proposal aims to implement a holistic tokenomics framework to incentivise Tier 1 level contributions from community members. This means that a Cardano DAO (C-DAO) native token will be minted for the purposes of distributing to Catalyst community members (and other C-DAO's). The distribution of these tokens will be in accordance with contribution metrics, which will also be determined by member engagement levels within Catalyst (and other C-DAO's). Participation will be incentivised through gamification, that allows members to unlock higher tiers and token utility/rewards as they progress through the member pathway.
How do we ensure the group of decision makers is diverse and accessible to newcomers?
Admittedly, this is a meritocratic tokenomic model. We have found from experience that, despite our best intentions at inclusivity, the core actors and decision-makers in the community are comprised of a 'coalition of the willing'. Therefore, a tiered membership pathway will be better able to attract diversity and newcomers by incentivising their contributions, and providing more opportunities for reward as they contribute more.
How can we ensure that the Catalyst process keeps iterating to improve?
The NFT-DAO are developing ways to improve member engagement and rewards via a native NFT-DAO token. Catalyst uses proposals as a means to provide solutions to problems posed by the Catalyst team and the community. One of the tiers within the member pathway is to unlock Bounty Access. The work we are doing in NFT-DAO can also be leveraged across Catalyst if the community agrees with the approach. One approach is, at a certain tier of engagement, the Catalyst team and community can place Bounties for initiatives, solutions or jobs that need to be done in the community (to iterate or improve on an existing idea), and that contributors will be rewarded in C-DAO, ADA or a Pro-Bono native token. Bounties can then be signed off by Community QA's, who also receive a Pro-Bono token for their service. This is our initial idea and can be influenced by collaboration as we move forward.
How will we include the community in decision making?
One of the utilities to be unlocked is governance. This not only means voting for proposals, but for anything. This can potentially work on two fronts:
1--Lower Member Engagement: Contribution tokens can provide a nominal contribution token payment for a lower tier of member engagement in the community, such as voting on a poll. Polls can support a casual form of decision-forming, that can be incentivised;
2--Higher Member Engagement: Governance tokens can provide members with a weighted vote on more pressing community issues, such as voting on a policy. These higher tier utilities require a consistent degree of engagement within the community to be earned (not just the amount of ADA held) so that members with less ADA can build merit and make equitable contributions toward more impactful outcomes.
A solution may arise in the form of a more robust voting dApp (or enhancement of the current one) so that polls can be made available (for Level 1 Contribution Token holders) or governance votes (for higher-level Governance Token holders). A linked wallet can allow members to receive nominal payments for contributions.
ROADMAP / COSTS
To support the implementation of a holistic tokenisation model for Project Catalyst within the next two Catalyst Rounds, NFT-DAO will merge our own tokenomics development:
MAY 2021 | FUND 5 CLOSE + FUND 6 OPEN
• Dev Team: Contribution token minting/test/pre-distribution (pre-alpha)
• Dev Team: Token minting policy
• Gov Holon: NFT-DAO Charter: terms of engagement
• Gov Holon: Finalise Tokenomics model
• Open-source policy (with QA-DAO)
MONTH COSTS: $7,000
JUNE 2021 | FUND 6 CLOSE + FUND 5 PAYMENT
• Tokenomics Roll-out / troubleshooting (alpha)
• C-DAO tokenomics discussion (with DAO Council)
• Project Catalyst team meetings
• Metrics capture implementation strategy
• Ideation with Project Catalyst Voting app team
• Voting dApp research project
• Bounty system flow-chart
• Finalise Rewards system
• Gamification system design
MONTH COSTS: $12,000
JULY 2021 | FUND 7 OPEN
• Tokenomics Roll-out / troubleshooting (beta)
MONTH COSTS: $5,000
AUG 2021 | FUND 7 CLOSE + FUND 6 PAYMENT
• Full Tokenomics Roll-out / maintenance
MONTH COSTS: $5,000
OCT 2021 | FUND 7 PAYMENT
KEY METRICS
Project Metrics will include but are not limited to:
• Establishing auditable Github repos for all core project tasks;
• Number of tokens minted;
• Collaborative partnerships (Catalyst, DAO's);
• Community consensus/ratification/participation on token rollout;
• Contribution Metrics per Token Development Cycle;
• Proof of iteration via rollout staging.
DEFINED SUCCESS REPORTING
3-month: Post funding much of this work will be available to see first hand and can be followed in the Github repository.
6-month: Active usage of contribution tokens in NFT-DAO.
12-month: Launch ready governance tokens in NFT-DAO and the stretch goal of Catalyst actually adopting our model for use with the wider community as suggested herein.
CONCLUSION
NFT-DAO is an emerging, self-organising community that is patterned after Cardano and Project Catalyst. Having experienced the challenges of building a collaborative community from scratch, we are positioned to support Project Catalyst using a native token model to reward community members for their voluntary contributions. Beginning with the pre-alpha minting of contribution tokens, this project will have potential to stage out into a larger project that supports multiple tiered token utilities and member pathways that incentivise community engagement and higher quality decision-making. In the spirit of collaboration, we aim to do this by working with the Project Catalyst team and community, the QA-DAO (for quality assurance and open-sourcing standards), the Council of Catalyst DAO's; and by testing and trouble-shooting within the NFT-DAO itself.
TEAM

Troy is an NFT-DAO Co-Proposer and Catalyst Fund3 Co-Recipient; NFT-DAO Governance Holon Lead; PhD student studying collaborative strategies within the creative economies; 20 years' experience in the creative, health and community development sectors in New Zealand and Australia. Troy is supporting NFT-DAO's tokenomics model and roll-out.

Dan is a high-frequency contributor within the NFT-DAO and member of the UX/UI, marketing and governance holons. He is a scrum master, business analyst, an agile PM in software development and blockchain entrepreneur (one of his businesses won the 2019 aeternity Starfleet accelerator program). Stephen Whitenstall (QA-DAO)
Stephen has 30 years' experience in organizing academic, community and business projects. Most recently he has been building the Governance HOLON GitHub in collaboration with NFT-DAO. He is also submitting a proposal for his own QA-DAO and is a co-proposer for A Council of Catalyst DAO's and NFTDAO: Industry Standards 1. Stephen is supporting NFT-DAO QA.

He currently operates a venture studio in Laramie WY building technology solutions with partners. Nothing prevents organisations or individuals to create as many digital accounts, as many credentials, as many user profiles they want.
By this mean, what's the value of a digital vote if someone or some organisation can vote as many times as needed to achieve willings that goes against the interests of a community.
In real life, individuals have a voting right after a process of authentication, which consist in checking claims that prove a voter is a unique person. Claims can be very diverses. Like a birth certificate, a familiy booklet, an id card, a driving license, a DNA sequences (!), you name it. All these claims are managed in a centralized maner, by civil institutions, depending on governments or states.

I have been part of Catalyst from the start (I participated in Fund0) and my experience finding information is probably still no better than those just joining now who are reporting difficulty finding out how to participate. This doesn't seem to be a difficult challenge to address if we are prepared to accept that some centralisation (yes that dirty word that everyone in crypto hates) is required for a while.
I would therefore like to make the following suggestions.
1. Central Starting Page - This seemed like a logical first artefact for project Catalyst to implement to be able to effectively communicate with the community. While there are lots of links to documents, chat channels and other resources discussed in the town halls, they are not easy to access or remember. A central page with an easy to remember URL would allow links to resources to be built out over time. As the community has already picked up the initiative for this with https://project-catalyst.github.io/, can I suggest that this site be hosted at https://catalyst.cardano.org? This URL is easy to remember and advertise and using cardano.org means it is clear that it isn't owned by any one actor (i.e. it is a community managed resource). This URL should be advertised at the start of every town hall with big letters saying START HERE, so that new people know where to go. They should be reminded at the start not to ask questions about how to get involved, until they have consumed as much information from this site as possible.
2. DRY - This acronym is used in development to mean Don't Repeat Yourself. I have noticed that in many of the town halls Dor often repeats much of the information already provided in previous town halls. This is not an effective use of town hall time. I appreciate that this is intended for newcomers, however this approach for helping newcomers is not sustainable. I would therefore suggest that instructions provided in town halls be clipped into dedicated videos that can be linked to on the above starting page. If the instructions need to change then they could be covered in a new town hall with the linked instruction video being updated. Short video clips are easier for people to consume, especially if they are only interested in a specific topic.

I'm imagining a person who has a great idea that would be perfect for project catalyst and who is naive to the crypto industry and shopping around for the right platform to build it on and maybe the means to get it funded. Cardano's the right platform, but Cardano hasn't made that leap yet to be the obvious choice for many of the future innovators looking for a home because there's so much loud fluff out there.
 
Crypto media is pretty awful- it will never be a fair funnel for cardano and will only send people over when the price goes through the moon- and when that time comes, we better have a healthy ecosystem in place that can healthily integrate ambitious, high-reward proposals and grow stronger.
 
So right now, the funnel that's in place for PC is drawing from a pool of folks who've largely been charmed by Cardano due in large part to dumb luck. If a friend hadn't told me to check out Charles, I don't know if I'd have found my way in yet. I would probably just be getting into it now seeing something edge up next to ETH on coinmarketcap…
 
Here's one way that I think we can make the edge of the funnel a little slipperier: a forum. I participated in a couple online workshops that used a platform similar to this one on ideascale. There was a balance of encouraged discussion on forums- open topics and directed questions- as well as encouraged feedback on "works in progress" roughly analogous to "proposals". I thought that this was successful in building community- sparking relationships between people with e.g. aligned missions.
 
Is the absense of a forum here on cardano.ideascale purposeful? Should we focus all our typing into comments within proposals? Is there already a healthy forum at discord, not something we want to disturb? Because, I personally wish there was a forum right here, one click away.
Back to the funnel- once the funnel leads you here to cardano.ideascale, and you click into the world, you see a bunch of proposals. There is a search filter, but it's not great. There's a search function, that's good. But otherwise you just see a bunch of proposals... And there's a good chance you aren't inspired by things you see on the first page, which might encourage you to take the chance to develop that wacky idea (a good thing) or you'll come away thinking that this isn't the right home for your brilliant wacky idea... yet.
I do think this will all naturally improve, and I appreciate that this is a huge experiment in itself, a huge task for the PC team. But I wonder what initial improvements, like a good forum, could do to make this a really rich ecosystem of ideas and support and comeraderie and common purpose.

remarks:
Can you articulate the gap between the current state and the expected or envisioned state?


Problem
Sites such as Craig's List or Facebook Market Place lack the full trust that smart contracts will provide in the future for a buyer and a seller.
 
Current State Example
If I purchase an Item off of Craig's List from a random person and that person sells me a product which doesn't work. I currently have no system which provides this seller with a rating. I also have no mechanism like a smart contract that will show the seller I'm serious by funding a smart contract before I meet them to let them know I'm a serious buyer. Currently, there is not a good way to create trust for the seller and the buyer.
* Current System - No identity verification
* Current System - You don't need to fund a contract up-front
* Current System - No transaction history or documented mechanism to release payment if purchasers expectations are met
 
Future State Example
By developing a Craig's List/ FB Marketplace Goods Exchange platform using smart contracts , it will now allow a transaction to happen that will allow the seller to efficiently follow-up only on qualified leads, make bidding for items more efficient and allow buyers to have confidence in the sellers rating and validated ID's from users participating in the system.
*Key Benefit for Seller: Only deals with qualified leads because the purchaser will fund a smart contract up front.
*Key Benefit of the Buyer: Only deals with Sellers that have a good seller rating and also will not release the money until the product has been inspected to prohibit fraud.
 
* Future State - Bother users must be verified
* Future State - Contract must be funded before transaction takes place
* Future State - Transaction history is recorded and a mechanism is provided to release payment if expectations are met.
